> > > Well...as much as this is tearing me up to post
> > > this, I have to suck it up
> > > and do it.
> > >
> > > I'm selling off my record collection. I have a
> > > shitload of vinyl, so I'm not
> > >
> > > going to take the time to catalog it all and list
> > > it. I'm going to open up
> > > times at my apartment where you all can come and dig
> > > thru my stacks, listen,
> > >
> > > and god willing - purchase stuff.
> > >
> > > Some VERY IMPORTANT DETAILS....I *cannot* do deals -
> > > either for bulk or for
> > > visual wear & tear issues. My financial situation is
> > > positively dire, so
> > > please don't give me shit about prices or try
> > > haggling - this is literally
> > > everything I own that's worth anything, and it's
> > > killing me to part with
> > > them.
> > >
> > > The vast majority of my records have been well cared
> > > for. They may needs
> > > some cleaning, but all in all they're in great
> > > condition.
> > >
> > > I have everything from breakbeat, to house,
> > > tech-house, drum & bass, trance
> > > and more. I have a ton of older stuff that's rare or
> > > hard to find, or just
> > > plain obscenely expensive due to rarity or
> > > popularity.
> > >
> > > After the vinyl, my mixer will go - it's a Vestax
> > > PMC 250, used, but works
> > > great. I think I can even get an extra cross fader
> > > for you from a friend of
> > > mine (but I'll have to check on that).
> > >
> > > I'll be holding back one bag's worth of records for
> > > what will most likely be
> > >
> > > my last gig @ 1015 on the 21st of this month - after
> > > that night, those
> > > records will be for sale as well.
> > >
> > > Anyone who has heard me knows I have good
> > > records...so please, if you know
> > > folks who are looking, let me know.
> > >
> > > I seriously feel sick posting this - but my life
> > > went to hell over the last
> > > month, and there's no end in sight. I have tried to
> > > find a 2nd job, but
> > > every opportunity has fallen through, my rent is
> > > late, my bank is way
> > > overdrawn, when my next paycheck comes in, it'll be
> > > decimated within minutes
> > >
> > > then I'll be back in the red. I have about 10 things
> > > poised to go to
> > > collections, and no way to recover. I've tried to
> > > look for a loan of some
> > > kind, but my credit is just shitty enough to make
> > > sure that'll never happen.
> > >
> > > I'd ask my folks for money, but I don't come from a
> > > well off family, so
> > > that's also a dead end. This is my last resort...I
> > > hope you guys can help
> > > me.
> > >
> > > Thanks for all the support everyone has given me in
> > > my DJing...it's really
> > > meant the world to me. I wish there was another way
> > > for me to get around
> > > this dilemma - as DJing has been my sanctuary for
> > > the last 5 years. Maybe
> > > some day in the future I'll be back, but for now,
> > > it's time to face the
> > > music one last time.
> > >
> > > ~Marco

chance we'll be going forward with this party on Friday, 4/14.  The current
forecast calls for some scatter showers friday evening, then broken clouds
and even some sunshine on saturday morning.  If you don't have the info, as=

rained out, we'll most likely be doing a free outdoor make-up party the
following friday, the 21st.

> > > records...so please, if you know
> > > folks who are looking, let me know.
> > >
> > > I seriously feel sick posting this - but my life
> > > went to hell over the last
> > > month, and there's no end in sight. I have tried to
> > > find a 2nd job, but
> > > every opportunity has fallen through, my rent is
> > > late, my bank is way
> > > overdrawn, when my next paycheck comes in, it'll be
> > > decimated within minutes
> > >
> > > then I'll be back in the red. I have about 10 things
> > > poised to go to
> > > collections, and no way to recover. I've tried to
> > > look for a loan of some
> > > kind, but my credit is just shitty enough to make
> > > sure that'll never happen.
> > >
> > > I'd ask my folks for money, but I don't come from a
> > > well off family, so
> > > that's also a dead end. This is my last resort...I
> > > hope you guys can help
> > > me.
> > >
> > > Thanks for all the support everyone has given me in
> > > my DJing...it's really
> > > meant the world to me. I wish there was another way
> > > for me to get around
> > > this dilemma - as DJing has been my sanctuary for
> > > the last 5 years. Maybe
> > > some day in the future I'll be back, but for now,
> > > it's time to face the
> > > music one last time.
> > >
> > > ~Marco
> > >
> > >

> > > Express yourself instantly with MSN Messenger!
> > > Download today - it's FREE!

It was posted here before being posted on tribe, in the last two SFRaves 
Calendar mailings last Friday and Saturday, respectively and now as well 
in a formal listing


  >
> Since a lot of people are choosing to stay quiet on this, I'll play bad  cop,
> mmkay? Because this raises a few questions:
>
> 1) Why not call it something else since, as far as I can tell,  SFR was
> totally out of the loop on this?

It's a birthday party for SFRaves and a benefit for Hyperreal plus a 
not-for-profit charity - I am requesting input on the list for the charity 
to be determined. All artists are donating their time and proceeds will 
benefit Hyperreal (SFRaves) as a gift back to SFRaves / Hyperreal for the 
14 years of hosting this list, our website and community. A portion of the 
proceeds will benefit a local non-profit charity as determined per the 
SFRaves list vote / decision to GIVE back to the community.

>
> 2) An SFR "Benefit"? Sorry, who is this benefiting? Do we get a say in  it?

Please see previous answers.

> 3) Karina, can you explain why specifically you (or whoever) chose to 
call
> this an SFR event? How is SFR at all related to this party other than your
> involvement in both and the date of the event being shared with SFR's
> anniversary?


Please see above. There is an open invitation for all to participate if 
interested. This is a Benefit for SFRaves and Birthday for SFRaves - as 
far as the intention is and the benefit is for - SFRaves is the intended 
celebrant, participant and recipient.


>
> Uh.. I don't get it.
>
> heart,

>


I hope that this community can appreciate a gift back in lieu of finding 
soemthing wrong with a benefit for SFRaves - this intention is the bring 
the community together, not tear it apart.

Love Karina

On Apr 12, 2006, at 2:28 PM, Karina wrote:
>>
>> 1)  who is organizing it
>

> of folks who have already responded from the community, those who  
> wish to participate from the SFRaves List PLUS community - as well  
> as the End Up, myself and other voluteers.


So basically - Karina decides there will be an "SF Raves" party, then  
starts looking for "participants".

Karina, this has been an issue before, and here it is again. We all  
know you admin the list, but this is more than just a list - it's a  
community.  If you are going to have an event and say that it is for,  
and by, the community, well then you had better make sure that the  
community is invited to help plan the event, from it's inception.

I consider this an abuse of your 'authority' (for lack of a better  
term) with the SFR List.  I'm not the only one who feels this way.

-philip-

Hi: Please excuse me if I'm being presumptuous, but given the discussions I just thought I would post these three software engineering positions that Doug is trying to fill at his work (he's Director of Engineering, so the jobs report to him).
   
  Zinio is a smallish company in San Francisco, nice people, steady, profitable, and they need help big time. I think their Product Development and QA departments also have openings, so if you don't do user-interface, maybe there's something else. 
   
  Anyway, just wanted to toss it out there - based on the talk it just seems like a lot of folks on the list are technology types and you never know. Hope this doesn't offend - it's well-meant. If you have any questions, you're welcome to contact me offline.

Subject: [sfraves] Clarification of the Benefit @ Endup on May 18th

------=_Part_10033_25450635.1144879265360
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=ISO-8859-1
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable
Content-Disposition: inline

It seems there has been some confusion as to how this event has come to be.


This was brought up by Shatter, who has been around for many years in one
form or another.  He suggested that with the change of the format on
Thursdays, it would be nice gesture on behalf of The Endup to do something
for the SF Rave community at large.

Over the past 14 years the SF Raves community has grown from being a small
sub page on Hyper Real to a comprehensive collective of people world wide
ranging from the mailing list, to tribe, friendster, MySpave, Live Journal,
and beyond.  It has grown beyond San Francisco, to something world wide.

The Endup recognizes all of the accomplishments, the ability to keep this
alive when all odds are against you, be it political, govenment, police, an=
d
mainstream.  The Endup knows these problems all too well.

Thus, we decided we wante dto do something for everyone.  Shatter put out
the call for DJ's who fell SF Raves have given them something, and want a
chance to give back.  Shatter has known Karina Powers personally for many
years, and knows her as a contact point for the SF Raves community.

The Endup has been using Tribe for a while now for overall community
involvement, thus, it was posted there first.

Just to note, this isn't a 14th Anniversary party.  It's a SF Raves benefit
hosted by The Endup.  We would never be so bold as to decide to throw the
official SF Raves anniversary.  If that was percieved by any of the posting=
,
our apologies.  That was not our intent.  We just simply were acknowledging
14 years of work by teh SF Raves community.

I hope this clears things up.

If you have any concerns or questions, please direct them to this adress.
If you are interested in contributing to this benefit, contact
shatter@sonic.net directly with the subject line NEXUS.


Thank you

------=_Part_10033_25450635.1144879265360--

More on Software Engineering jobs:

1. Craigslist (of course)
2. Dice.com - I get at least 3 e-mails a week almost bordering on spam from
recruters there
3. linkedin.com  this is by far the coolest thing for networking and findin=
g
jobs, (60% of finding a good job is who you know and how you present
yourself)

8-p

In a message dated 4/12/2006 3:01:42 PM Pacific Standard Time,  
endup.sf@gmail.com writes:

This was  brought up by Shatter, who has been around for many years in one 
form or  another.  He suggested that with the change of the format on Thursdays, 
 it would be nice gesture on behalf of The Endup to do something for the SF  
Rave community at large.
That's cool. I can't speak for everyone, but I don't think anyone would  
object to that.

Shatter  put out
the call for DJ's who fell SF Raves have given them something, and  want a
chance to give back.  Shatter has known Karina Powers  personally for many
years, and knows her as a contact point for the SF  Raves community.
Sorry, and was this call for DJs posted on SFR? I don't  think anyone saw it 
on here. Seems that would be the most relevant place to post  it and it's 
obvious that people would have been interested, as evident by the  recent crop of 
postings volunteering their skills since all of this came  up. Thus, seems 
like a call to DJs/BSP about this/call for party planning would  have generated a 
large response.

The  Endup has been using Tribe for a while now for overall  community
involvement, thus, it was posted there first.
Okay... but that's still a strange thing to do. I'm not going to change my  
position on that.

Just to  note, this isn't a 14th Anniversary party.  It's a SF Raves  benefit
hosted by The Endup.  We would never be so bold as to decide  to throw the
official SF Raves anniversary.  If that was percieved by  any of the posting,
our apologies.  That was not our intent.  We  just simply were acknowledging
14 years of work by teh SF Raves  community.

Uh.. you *might* want to speak with Karina about that, then:
 
-From her recent response: "It's a birthday party for  SFRaves and a benefit 
for Hyperreal plus a 
not-for-profit charity -  I am requesting input on the list for the charity 
to be determined."
 
-And on her tribe posting: "SFRaves 14th BDAY ANNIVERSARY BASH  

SFRaves Calendar 11th ANNIVERSARY CELEBRATION"
 
That is *seriously* misleading if indeed this is simply a benefit for  
SFRaves. In fact, to avoid confusion, I would suggest removing "birthday"  or 
"anniversary" from the title of the event all together. When explaining your  
reasoning for throwing the party, you can certainly note that with fourteen  years 
under its belt of giving to the community, you thought you would  do the same 
and give something back to SFR. That seems perfectly reasonable and  still 
accomplishes your goal. Using either "birthday" or "anniversary" in the  title a 
misleading use of the word in this case. If nothing else, it should say,  "SFR 
Benefit: In Honor of Its 14th Birthday" or something along those  lines.
 
Also, from the tribe posting: "We're looking for DJ's specifically that SF  
Raves have helped, a testamonial of sorts. All talent will be ran past SF Raves 
 for final approval. "
 
I don't know if that was added since all of this came up, since I didn't  see 
that before and neither did a few other people. I don't think people would  
have made such a fuss if that condition was previously listed, but perhaps we  
all managed to not see it. Either way, I think people would appreciate  that.
 
Thanks for the e-mail trying to clear this all up. I still think this all  
seems a little strange and poorly orchestrated, but good luck with the party,  
regardless.
 
Heart,
Alida

-------------------------------1144885987--

Subject: [sfraves] June Pointer Loses Cancer Battle

Content-Type: text/plain; charset="us-ascii"



June Pointer Loses Cancer Battle 




Diva, 52, was youngest member of the Grammy-winning trio 

June Pointer, the youngest of the Grammy-winning trio the Pointer Sisters, who scored hits with "I'm So Excited" and "Jump (For My Love)," died of an undisclosed type of cancer on Tuesday in Los Angeles. She was fifty-two years old.

June had been hospitalized since February, and, according to a family statement, died "in the arms of her sisters, Ruth and Anita," and with her brothers Aaron and Fritz "by her side." The statement continues, "Although her sister, Bonnie, was unable to be present, she was with her in spirit."

The singing sisters got their start in San Francisco in the early Seventies as a quartet, sporting a Forties thrift-shop look and a vintage vocal style that incorporated scat and be-bop. The group sang backup for Grace Slick, Boz Scaggs, Taj Mahal and Elvin Bishop, before releasing their self-titled debut in 1973. That album spawned their first Grammy win for the song "Fairytale."

http://tinyurl.com/ljv4h

My benefactor told me about it once when I was young and my blood was too vigorous for me to understand it.  Now I do understand it.  I will tell you what it is:  'Does this path have a heart?' If it does the path is good.  If it doesn't, it is of no use."
-Don Juan

-Jacques Attali in his seminal text "Noise"

On 4/12/06, LittleEtoile@aol.com <LittleEtoile@aol.com> wrote:
>
> That's cool. I can't speak for everyone, but I don't think anyone would
> object to that.


We didn't think so either.  We enjoy the music, and we realize that while
there are at times a division between the clubs and the underground,  we
still like to think that we can support each other in some way.  Obviously
the underground fills in gaps that we legally can't work with (under 21 for
instance) however we dont think that the vibe or the sound should have to
stop once you can walk into a bar or club.  This was what lead to the
forming of NEXUS @ The Endup.

will.

Subject: Re: [sfraves] Clarification of the Benefit @ Endup on May 18th

i think what's causing some of the problems is that some folks know
SFRaves only from the calander, the website and social networking
sites.  on sites such as Tribe, Karina is the main contact.

though, the history of SFR is rooted in the mailing list.  there are
long time members of this community that probably don't even belong to
the SFR tribe on Tribe (and actually there are two SFR tribes) or on
Myspace.

i belong to those groups on Tribe and Myspace.  to me, those aren't a
real community.  the postings, bulletins and listings on those sites
are limited.  rarely updated.  mostly, it's Karina posting up BSPs.=20
nothing wrong with that at all, but i don't think it reflects the SFR
community.

i've been on this list since 1999.  there are people who have been on
the list much longer than that.  i think in some geeky way we all
consider ourselves to be a part of SFRaves and contributing members of
what this community is about.

no single person can represent SFR.  no handfull of people can
represent SFR.  this is a group.

this event and the call for volunteers and DJs was posted off list
before it was posted on-list.  i'm sorry Karina, but saying that it
was buried as an event listing within the calander does not cut it.=20
one, a lot of people here don't read the calander and two, the event
is over a month away so who would actually scroll down to read that
far?

at the very least, it should have been announced here at the same time
as on Tribe, Myspace, etc.

if that had happened, then most of this confusion and resulting
dramarama would have been avoided.

Subject: Re: [sfraves] SFRaves summer day party?

we did a small party at GG park last summer and got shut down because
of noise compaints.

the park officer said basically we would have been fine if we'd gotten
a permit that cost something stupid like $25-$50.

it was funnier that while he was talking to us, about 3-4 of us were
smoking cigarettes.  he pointed out that there is also a fine of $100
or so per person smoking.  we all kinda said "oh...."

we didn't get fined.

Subject: Re: [sfraves] Clarification of the Benefit @ Endup on May 18th

Clearly, as Alida mentioned, this is a poorly orchestrated event. SFRaves 
has historically thrown its own parties, so to have third parties 
out-of-the-blue come out and announce an SFR event, will certainly call a 
stir. (Not to mention a very similar scenario happened last year)

I'm also not clear on how MySpace and Tribe fits into this. As Bam 
mentioned, both groups have few posts, and very little discussion.

However, this time around it is clear that Karina and the EndUp are 
planning this event as a benefit *to* SFRaves, as opposed to 
*representing* SFRaves. So as long as hyperreal gets a check or this list 
gets to decide which charity proceeds go to, I suppose it's fine.

Just a really weird approach, I think.

-t
------------------------------------------
terry estioko     | terry@hyperreal.org
SFRaves moderator | http://www.sfraves.org

On Thu, 13 Apr 2006, Bam wrote:

> i think what's causing some of the problems is that some folks know
> SFRaves only from the calander, the website and social networking
> sites.  on sites such as Tribe, Karina is the main contact.
>
> though, the history of SFR is rooted in the mailing list.  there are
> long time members of this community that probably don't even belong to
> the SFR tribe on Tribe (and actually there are two SFR tribes) or on
> Myspace.
>
> i belong to those groups on Tribe and Myspace.  to me, those aren't a
> real community.  the postings, bulletins and listings on those sites
> are limited.  rarely updated.  mostly, it's Karina posting up BSPs.
> nothing wrong with that at all, but i don't think it reflects the SFR
> community.
>
> i've been on this list since 1999.  there are people who have been on
> the list much longer than that.  i think in some geeky way we all
> consider ourselves to be a part of SFRaves and contributing members of
> what this community is about.
>
> no single person can represent SFR.  no handfull of people can
> represent SFR.  this is a group.
>
> this event and the call for volunteers and DJs was posted off list
> before it was posted on-list.  i'm sorry Karina, but saying that it
> was buried as an event listing within the calander does not cut it.
> one, a lot of people here don't read the calander and two, the event
> is over a month away so who would actually scroll down to read that
> far?
>

> as on Tribe, Myspace, etc.
>

Subject: Re: [sfraves] SFRaves summer day party?

http://www.parks.sfgov.org/site/uploadedfiles/recpark/Permits_and_Reservati=
ons/special_events.pdf

Long story short - call 415-831-5500 and ask about "special events"

We used to throw daytime evets all the time in parks when I lived in
austin & they were always super fun.  Getting the permit there was
just a formality, but you had to reserve months in advance.

-jasonh

2. The past always tries to control the creativity that builds on it.
3. Free societies enable the future by living in the past.

Subject: RE: [sfraves] SFRaves summer day party?

I actually asked one of the DB guys about that randomly the other day, he
said they have been just reserving one of the more out of the way spots in
GG for their parties for real cheap, but the last one got big to the point
where they drew too much attention and now they're gettting an official
sound permit or whatever it's called that costs $500.  I'd guess an SFR
party would be small enough to not cause much trouble as long as we didn't
bring ridiculous sound and we didn't pick one of the more trafficed
locations.

I'd also vote for keeping the party in SF if possible, there are a lot of
people like me here that don't have cars, not that I couldn't hitch a ride
but spots in SF are generally easier for everyone to reach.

A

Subject: [sfraves] (SRR) AOL Music... Surprisingly Cool...

Thanks to whoever posted that Dieselboy link to the
AOL Full CD Listen section. I'm surprised that it's
actually a really good selection of music [especially
given the source]. For those who haven't checked the
area out, it's crossplatform now, whereas just a few
months ago I remember going on the site & it basically
said "Go to Hell, Mac user." Old skoolers will
defintely want to check out this week's selections
which features a supremely guilty pleasure Tommy Boy
compilation... Just be careful with it at work,
coworkers will look at you funny when you start to do
the robot in your cubicle...

Subject: Re: [sfraves] SFRaves summer day party?

before people get too much into what kind of music and who is
playing...IMHO we should figure out the theme of the event.

who do we want to attend?  what kind of vibe are we creating?  what
resources do we have to make this event special?  what's the goal of
the party?

these things are much more important than getting a lineup of DJs.  ;)

playing...IMHO we should figure out the theme of the event.

I'm not a DJ, but do compose and play electronic music, mostly
more like New Age or academic stuff than EDM,   b u t   ...
I could get really stoked about doing live original music for
a chill space at a summer day, full moon, or whatever.

and organize the sets so we could enjoy the party, too,
maybe do some jamming together.

My use of "chill" = meditative and calm.

Blue Fire  aka  Will Grant

> party would be small enough to not cause much trouble as long as we didn't
> bring ridiculous sound and we didn't pick one of the more trafficed
> locations.
>
> I'd also vote for keeping the party in SF if possible, there are a lot of
> people like me here that don't have cars, not that I couldn't hitch a ride
> but spots in SF are generally easier for everyone to reach.
>
> A
>

>    Aprl 22nd:  Evil Ferrets @ Alpha Bar - Aaron Jae's Birthday Crackup
>    May 20th:  DIRTY w/ Circuitbreaker @ Jelly's 
>    July 21st:  Mighty Breaks
>

>    To unsubscribe, e-mail: sfraves-unsubscribe@hyperreal.org 
>    For additional commands, e-mail: sfraves-help@hyperreal.org

>  Full Moon April 14th
>  Full Moon May 12th
>  Free Day Party May TBA 

MySpace:  http://www.myspace.com/DJApollo 

Tribenet:   <http://people.tribe.net/djapollo2k>http://people.tribe.net/djapollo2k 

Moksha Tribe:  www.mokshatribe.org
                
House Music 101:  http://livingart.com/raving/articles/housemusic101.htm

"Look at every path closely and deliberately.  Try it as many times as you think necessary.  Then ask yourself and yourself alone one question.  This question is one that only a very old man asks.  My benefactor told me about it once when I was young and my blood was too vigorous for me to understand it.  Now I do understand it.  I will tell you what it is:  'Does this path have a heart?' If it does the path is good.  If it doesn't, it is of no use."
-Don Juan

"A nation of sheep will beget a government of wolves."
-Edward R. Murrow

"Music is prophecy, its style and economic organization are ahead of the rest of society. It makes audible the new world that will gradually become visible."
-Jacques Attali in his seminal text "Noise"



--=====================_4289578==.ALT--

chill, meet people, hope it's sunny, and don't turn it into more of a fiasco
than it needs to be. :-)

hello Marc\(O\) and Erin Akamine, yes, it was me!  thanks!  y'all made my
day!  :)

i think aol is cool exposure for edm ... one time i heard drum and bass
coming from my 16-year old daughter's computer and when she left her room
for a minute i snuck in and her computer was on aol.  :)

also i understand aol broadcasts xm radio which is dope - that means we
could hear edm on "the move"/ channel 80.  :)

respect,
mary  :)

 Subject: (SRR) AOL Music... Surprisingly

Thanks to whoever posted that Dieselboy link to the
AOL Full CD Listen section. I'm surprised that it's
actually a really good selection of music [especially
given the source]. For those who haven't checked the
area out, it's crossplatform now, whereas just a few
months ago I remember going on the site & it basically
said "Go to Hell, Mac user." Old skoolers will
defintely want to check out this week's selections
which features a supremely guilty pleasure Tommy Boy
compilation... Just be careful with it at work,
coworkers will look at you funny when you start to do
the robot in your cubicle...

Subject: Re: [sfraves] Clarification of the Benefit @ Endup on May 18th

------=_Part_24500_24238532.1144971192694
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=ISO-8859-1
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable
Content-Disposition: inline

Yes, you are both correct in this.

As stated, Endup has a presence on Tribe & MySpace (we havn't ventured onto
others yet).

Traditionally we havn't had any real promotion happening, nor for MANY year=
s
has the club bother to venture out past stock "house" music for a very long
time.

While we didn't make the anncouncement on this list first, we are making it
now.  Anyone who has been a part of SFRaves either in events, DJ'ing events=
,
gotten help with jobs, or feel that they have benefitted from SFRaves is
welcome to contribute.  This idea was never meant to be exclusive to anyone=
,
or to exclude anyone.  All are invited to participate (space and time
willing) and to attend.

Any DJ's that wold like to contribute, place contact
shatter@sonic.netdirectly with the subject line NEXUS  and he will
take in all applicants.
Please include a short summery of why you would like to help out, and what
your involvement in teh past has been.  This is to help weed out people
that, as Van pointed out, would like to just jump in without actually havin=
g
been a part of things.

After the selection has been weeded down, and before we go to print, we wil=
l
post the final candidates here so everyone can take a look at who the line
up will be.  Understand that we cannot please nor accomodate everyone, and
there are at time extinuating circumstances involved, but we wil make the
best possible effort to get in everyone possible.

Keep in mind there are lots of ways to be involved beyond DJing:  Additiona=
l
decorations,  Video Artists (inside and especially outside projected onto
the building itself), vendors (limited space, but it's available on a first
come first served basis)  as well as  fire dancers (if you havn't been to
The Endup, we have a nice space for fire dancers, that makes for amazing
pictures and video), hoola hoops,  and any other talent anyone has to
offer.  All submissions will be considered if possible.

While the event legally must be 21+, we can go to great lengths to make it
very culture friendly.

We're looking forward to this, as we hope all of you are as well.  We again
apologize for ANY mis communications or misrepresentations, as none of them
were intentional, nor did mean mean to offend anyone.

On 4/13/06, Terry Estioko <terry@hyperreal.org> wrote:
>
> Clearly, as Alida mentioned, this is a poorly orchestrated event. SFRaves
> has historically thrown its own parties, so to have third parties
> out-of-the-blue come out and announce an SFR event, will certainly call a
> stir. (Not to mention a very similar scenario happened last year)
>
> I'm also not clear on how MySpace and Tribe fits into this. As Bam
> mentioned, both groups have few posts, and very little discussion.
>
> However, this time around it is clear that Karina and the EndUp are
> planning this event as a benefit *to* SFRaves, as opposed to
> *representing* SFRaves. So as long as hyperreal gets a check or this list
> gets to decide which charity proceeds go to, I suppose it's fine.
>
> Just a really weird approach, I think.
>
> -t
> ------------------------------------------
> terry estioko     | terry@hyperreal.org
> SFRaves moderator | http://www.sfraves.org
>
> On Thu, 13 Apr 2006, Bam wrote:
>
> > i think what's causing some of the problems is that some folks know
> > SFRaves only from the calander, the website and social networking
> > sites.  on sites such as Tribe, Karina is the main contact.
> >
> > though, the history of SFR is rooted in the mailing list.  there are
> > long time members of this community that probably don't even belong to
> > the SFR tribe on Tribe (and actually there are two SFR tribes) or on
> > Myspace.
> >
> > i belong to those groups on Tribe and Myspace.  to me, those aren't a
> > real community.  the postings, bulletins and listings on those sites
> > are limited.  rarely updated.  mostly, it's Karina posting up BSPs.
> > nothing wrong with that at all, but i don't think it reflects the SFR
> > community.
> >
> > i've been on this list since 1999.  there are people who have been on
> > the list much longer than that.  i think in some geeky way we all
> > consider ourselves to be a part of SFRaves and contributing members of
> > what this community is about.
> >
> > no single person can represent SFR.  no handfull of people can
> > represent SFR.  this is a group.
> >
> > this event and the call for volunteers and DJs was posted off list
> > before it was posted on-list.  i'm sorry Karina, but saying that it
> > was buried as an event listing within the calander does not cut it.
> > one, a lot of people here don't read the calander and two, the event
> > is over a month away so who would actually scroll down to read that
> > far?
> >
> > at the very least, it should have been announced here at the same time
> > as on Tribe, Myspace, etc.
> >
> > if that had happened, then most of this confusion and resulting
> > dramarama would have been avoided.
> >
> > On 4/12/06, The Endup <endup.sf@gmail.com> wrote:
> >> On 4/12/06, LittleEtoile@aol.com <LittleEtoile@aol.com> wrote:
> >>>

> would
> >>> object to that.

> >>

> while
> >> there are at times a division between the clubs and the

> >> still like to think that we can support each other in some
> way.  Obviously
> >> the underground fills in gaps that we legally can't work with (under 2=
1
> for
> >> instance) however we dont think that the vibe or the sound should have
> to
> >> stop once you can walk into a bar or club.  This was what lead to the
> >> forming of NEXUS @ The Endup.
> >>
> >> Sorry, and was this call for DJs posted on SFR? I don't  think anyone
> saw it
> >>> on here. Seems that would be the most relevant place to post  it and

> >>> obvious that people would have been interested, as evident by
> the  recent
> >>> crop of
> >>> postings volunteering their skills since all of this came  up. Thus,
> seems
> >>> like a call to DJs/BSP about this/call for party planning would  have
> >>> generated a
> >>> large response.

> >> Until today we wern't on this list.  Time being what it is we generall=
y
> >> check the site, the calendar, and such.  Shatter is on Tribe frequentl=
y
> as
> >> well as MySpace, so it was a logical place for him to start looking,

> >> will.
> >>
> >> Okay... but that's still a strange thing to do. I'm not going to chang=
e
> my
> >>> position on that.
> >>
> >>
> >> I rememeber 10 years ago when if you didn't put out a direct mailing
> for an
> >> event, or hit the streets fliering, nobody would know about it.  Now
> you can
> >> simply throw and event with one email to a list.  I suspect 10 years
> from
> >> now the same will be said of email lists and social networking sites.
> >>
> >> Uh.. you *might* want to speak with Karina about that, then:
> >>
> >>
> >> We have.  Any mis-communications between ourselves and Karina would be

> >> our side.  We havn't done this type of event before.  It's new
> territory for
> >> us, so please be a little patient.  If you know anything about The
> Endup you
> >> know this to be very true, however we are VERY serious about expanding
> our
> >> horizons and our music.

> >>> "birthday"  or
> >>> "anniversary" from the title of the event all together. When

> >>> your
> >>> reasoning for throwing the party, you can certainly note that with
> >>> fourteen  years
> >>> under its belt of giving to the community, you thought you would  do
> the
> >>> same
> >>> and give something back to SFR. That seems perfectly reasonable

> >>> accomplishes your goal. Using either "birthday" or "anniversary" in
> >>> the  title a
> >>> misleading use of the word in this case. If nothing else, it should
> >>> say,  "SFR
> >>> Benefit: In Honor of Its 14th Birthday" or something along

"Look at every path closely and deliberately.  Try it as many times as you think necessary.  Then ask yourself and yourself alone one question.  This question is one that only a very old man asks.  My benefactor told me about it once when I was young and my blood was too vigorous for me to understand it.  Now I do understand it.  I will tell you what it is:  'Does this path have a heart?' If it does the path is good.  If it doesn't, it is of no use."
-Don Juan

-Edward R. Murrow

"Music is prophecy, its style and economic organization are ahead of the rest of society. It makes audible the new world that will gradually become visible."
-Jacques Attali in his seminal text "Noise"

Subject: [sfraves] Plaintiffs drop rave lawsuit

--=====================_47013984==.ALT
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="us-ascii"

Wednesday, April 12, 2006 
Plaintiffs drop rave lawsuit 

HEIDI TOTH - Daily Herald   

The class action lawsuit against Utah County over last year's rave is dead, for now.

On Monday, attorney Brian Barnard filed a first amended complaint in U.S. District Court, opting to "dismiss without prejudice their action and claims" against Utah County and several of the county's ranking officials, including all three commissioners, Sheriff James Tracy and County Attorney Kay Bryson. It's a strategic move to give them some time to plan, according to one of the plaintiffs.

For the county, though, it's a victory.

The legal hassles aren't over yet, said Peter Stirba, attorney for the county. A judge still has to order the case dismissed, and the county will ask for compensation for its legal fees, which have been significant, especially in light of a lawsuit he termed frivolous.

Brandon Fullmer agreed the case wasn't over; he said all of the involved parties decided they needed to regroup and reorganize their campaign. It is by no means over, he said; they will be refiling once the facts are straightened out.

"It's just kind of dragging out," he said.

The lawsuit was filed in September, a few weeks after the Aug. 20 raid of a CD release party on private property in Spanish Fork Canyon. Promoters Fullmer and Nick Mari and landowners Richard and Trudy Childs alleged various violations of the constitutional rights of partygoers by the sheriff's office, saying excessive force was used to break up the party and that the party was broken up even though UPROCK Records, Fullmer's business, had the correct permits.

The lawsuit also asked for a temporary restraining order that would not allow any more such activities to be broken up until the lawsuit was decided; U.S. District Judge Dale Kimball denied that request in September, citing multiple violations that gave Tracy the right to shut the party down, including drug use and failure to follow through with promised equipment and facilities.

In December, Barnard opened up the possibility of a class action lawsuit and set up a Web site encouraging all partygoers at the Aug. 20 party or an earlier party at the same location that also was broken up to come forward and participate. 

That Web site has Tuesday's date on it and reads, "This site has been taken down as there is no active lawsuit to report on."

Barnard could not be reached for comment.

Heidi Toth can be reached at 344-2543 or This email address is being protected from spam bots, you need Javascript enabled to view it 
This story appeared in The Daily Herald on page A4. 

http://tinyurl.com/qojl2 
  

MySpace:  http://www.myspace.com/DJApollo 

Tribenet:   <http://people.tribe.net/djapollo2k>http://people.tribe.net/djapollo2k 

Moksha Tribe:  www.mokshatribe.org
                
House Music 101:  http://livingart.com/raving/articles/housemusic101.htm

"Look at every path closely and deliberately.  Try it as many times as you think necessary.  Then ask yourself and yourself alone one question.  This question is one that only a very old man asks.  My benefactor told me about it once when I was young and my blood was too vigorous for me to understand it.  Now I do understand it.  I will tell you what it is:  'Does this path have a heart?' If it does the path is good.  If it doesn't, it is of no use."
-Don Juan

"A nation of sheep will beget a government of wolves."
-Edward R. Murrow

"Music is prophecy, its style and economic organization are ahead of the rest of society. It makes audible the new world that will gradually become visible."
-Jacques Attali in his seminal text "Noise"

Apollo wrote:
> Wednesday, April 12, 2006
> Plaintiffs drop rave lawsuit
>
> HEIDI TOTH - Daily Herald
>
> The class action lawsuit against Utah County over last year's rave is
> dead, for now.
>
> On Monday, attorney Brian Barnard filed a first amended complaint in U.S.
> District Court, opting to "dismiss without prejudice their action and
> claims" against Utah County and several of the county's ranking officials,
> including all three commissioners, Sheriff James Tracy and County Attorney
> Kay Bryson. It's a strategic move to give them some time to plan,
> according to one of the plaintiffs.
>
> For the county, though, it's a victory.
>
> The legal hassles aren't over yet, said Peter Stirba, attorney for the
> county. A judge still has to order the case dismissed, and the county will
> ask for compensation for its legal fees, which have been significant,
> especially in light of a lawsuit he termed frivolous.
>
> Brandon Fullmer agreed the case wasn't over; he said all of the involved
> parties decided they needed to regroup and reorganize their campaign. It
> is by no means over, he said; they will be refiling once the facts are
> straightened out.
>
> "It's just kind of dragging out," he said.
>
> The lawsuit was filed in September, a few weeks after the Aug. 20 raid of
> a CD release party on private property in Spanish Fork Canyon. Promoters
> Fullmer and Nick Mari and landowners Richard and Trudy Childs alleged
> various violations of the constitutional rights of partygoers by the
> sheriff's office, saying excessive force was used to break up the party
> and that the party was broken up even though UPROCK Records, Fullmer's
> business, had the correct permits.
>
> The lawsuit also asked for a temporary restraining order that would not
> allow any more such activities to be broken up until the lawsuit was
> decided; U.S. District Judge Dale Kimball denied that request in
> September, citing multiple violations that gave Tracy the right to shut
> the party down, including drug use and failure to follow through with
> promised equipment and facilities.
>
> In December, Barnard opened up the possibility of a class action lawsuit
> and set up a Web site encouraging all partygoers at the Aug. 20 party or
> an earlier party at the same location that also was broken up to come
> forward and participate.
>
> That Web site has Tuesday's date on it and reads, "This site has been
> taken down as there is no active lawsuit to report on."
>
> Barnard could not be reached for comment.
>
> Heidi Toth can be reached at 344-2543 or This email address is being
> protected from spam bots, you need Javascript enabled to view it
> This story appeared in The Daily Herald on page A4.
>
> http://tinyurl.com/qojl2
>
>
> MySpace:  http://www.myspace.com/DJApollo
>
> Tribenet:
> <http://people.tribe.net/djapollo2k>http://people.tribe.net/djapollo2k
>
> Moksha Tribe:  www.mokshatribe.org
>
> House Music 101:  http://livingart.com/raving/articles/housemusic101.htm
>
> "Look at every path closely and deliberately.  Try it as many times as you
> think necessary.  Then ask yourself and yourself alone one question.  This
> question is one that only a very old man asks.  My benefactor told me
> about it once when I was young and my blood was too vigorous for me to
> understand it.  Now I do understand it.  I will tell you what it is:
> 'Does this path have a heart?' If it does the path is good.  If it
> doesn't, it is of no use."
> -Don Juan
>
> "A nation of sheep will beget a government of wolves."
> -Edward R. Murrow
>
> "Music is prophecy, its style and economic organization are ahead of the
> rest of society. It makes audible the new world that will gradually become
> visible."
> -Jacques Attali in his seminal text "Noise"
>

Sad good Friday everyone! Why should we be happy? shouldn't we be sad today
and happy on Sunday? Sunday is PARTY TIME!!! (ok, well, we'll make it
Saturday!)

BTW- I have to work today and all weekend! Hey but that NSX (my dream for
the last 10+ years) will be worth it and also I think God will be happy
knowing that I can donate more money to the church if I make more money.

Anyway. I don't really believe too much in the whole day or rest thing sinc=
e
the Sun wasn't invented until the 4th day, how can we know how long a day
is? A day could have been millions or billions of years so the sabbith may
mean retirement.

8-p

Just something to think about.

> Apollo wrote:
> > Wednesday, April 12, 2006
> > Plaintiffs drop rave lawsuit
> >
> > HEIDI TOTH - Daily Herald
> >
> > The class action lawsuit against Utah County over last year's rave is
> > dead, for now.
> >
> > On Monday, attorney Brian Barnard filed a first amended complaint in U.S
> .
> > District Court, opting to "dismiss without prejudice their action and
> > claims" against Utah County and several of the county's ranking
> officials,
> > including all three commissioners, Sheriff James Tracy and County
> Attorney
> > Kay Bryson. It's a strategic move to give them some time to plan,
> > according to one of the plaintiffs.
> >
> > For the county, though, it's a victory.
> >
> > The legal hassles aren't over yet, said Peter Stirba, attorney for the
> > county. A judge still has to order the case dismissed, and the county
> will
> > ask for compensation for its legal fees, which have been significant,
> > especially in light of a lawsuit he termed frivolous.
> >
> > Brandon Fullmer agreed the case wasn't over; he said all of the involved
> > parties decided they needed to regroup and reorganize their campaign. It
> > is by no means over, he said; they will be refiling once the facts are
> > straightened out.
> >
> > "It's just kind of dragging out," he said.
> >
> > The lawsuit was filed in September, a few weeks after the Aug. 20 raid
> of
> > a CD release party on private property in Spanish Fork Canyon. Promoters
> > Fullmer and Nick Mari and landowners Richard and Trudy Childs alleged
> > various violations of the constitutional rights of partygoers by the
> > sheriff's office, saying excessive force was used to break up the party
> > and that the party was broken up even though UPROCK Records, Fullmer's
> > business, had the correct permits.
> >
> > The lawsuit also asked for a temporary restraining order that would not
> > allow any more such activities to be broken up until the lawsuit was
> > decided; U.S. District Judge Dale Kimball denied that request in
> > September, citing multiple violations that gave Tracy the right to shut
> > the party down, including drug use and failure to follow through with
> > promised equipment and facilities.
> >
> > In December, Barnard opened up the possibility of a class action lawsuit
> > and set up a Web site encouraging all partygoers at the Aug. 20 party or
> > an earlier party at the same location that also was broken up to come
> > forward and participate.
> >
> > That Web site has Tuesday's date on it and reads, "This site has been
> > taken down as there is no active lawsuit to report on."
> >
> > Barnard could not be reached for comment.
> >

> > protected from spam bots, you need Javascript enabled to view it

Subject: [sfraves] bsp: Sat.Apr.15 - [KONTROL] with PAN/TONE (SubStatic:Cologne) LIVE!

Tomorrow night IT'S ON once again!

Pan/Tone's stated mission: "Rock the dancefloor."

No chin-stroking here, folks.

Just some good ol' Saturday night rock-out, get down shit!

_________________________________________________


Saturday, April 15th

[ K O N T R O L ]

minimal techno + avant house
every 3rd Saturday at Rx Gallery


Featuring from Cologne, Germany

PAN/TONE - LIVE PA
Sub_Static . Background . Sender/Kompakt
Ladomat 2000 . Onitor . 240 Volts . Revolver

Whether answering to Sid LeRock, Gringo Grinder, or Shelbono
"Barracuda" del Monte, this Toronto native now living in Cologne is a
man of wry charm and multiple musical masks.  Under his Pan/Tone
alais, the two time MUTEK veteran takes sweaty minimal techno and
injects gnarling basslines, distorted synths, and a whisky-soaked
party vibe to create his signature "Rockno" sound.  Come see for your
self why the Germans call him "The Craziest Woodsman in Canada!"


with resident DJs:
ALLAND BYALLO ( liebe*detail . kvadrat produkt . mo's ferry )
SAMMY D  ( classic . dirtybird . utensil )
CRAIG KUNA   ( concept sf . esdjco )


Digital video art by ECON.net
Drink specials by JINRO soju

________________________________________________

Rx Gallery
132 Eddy @ Mason, SF / 415.474.7973
9pm-2am / 21+ / $10
________________________________________________

Check our website for full bios and lots FREE music!
http://www.kontrolsf.com

UPDATE: The photo gallery is finally up!
Also, download speeds are much faster now!

View the flyer here:
http://www.kontrolsf.com/K11W.jpg

________________________________________________


The life and times of the former Sheldon Thompson, aka PAN/TONE:

Native to the northern regions of Ontario where ice fishing and
ski-doos are all the rage, Shelbono LeRoche currently lives in
Cologne, Germany with at least 20 bars in walking distance (the
closest one is where you might suspect to find him.) With over 20
releases, 3 albums in 2004-2005 alone, the man with many faces is
bouncing and crashing his way around the world to bring new breath of
sounds to dancefloors under the alias's of PAN/TONE (sub-static,
sender/kompakt, 240 Volts), SID LeROCK (Ladomat2000, Mute) and GRINGO
GRINDER (Onitor). With a steady output of releases, he has seen one of
his busiest years unfold with great success, coming with the privilege
of seeing many new cities and meeting many like minded individuals.
With more production under way for future releases under all names,
Shelbono has been commited to detoxing himself to better health to
prepare himself again for 2006. The neighbours now find themselves
lucky to be next to a producer preparing for his next album(s) in the
midnight hours.

A warning to the promoters: Please make sure to tell him who he is
performing as in advance...things become a little fuzzy after a few
drinks...make sure to repeat, then send him on his way and all will be
fine...the music and the moment will meet its maker. Music will then
be very LOUD and the boys will be screaming like little girls and the
girls will be dancing all over your nice furniture... piss drunk like
a sailor.... which is exactly what happened at all of the following
clubs and/or festivals:

CANADA: MUTEK festival/montreal, footwork/toronto, element
club/toronto. ENGLAND (UK): london/FABRIC, london/foreign muck.
FRANCE: MUTEK festival/marseille, zoo bizarre/bordeaux,
montpellier/villa rouge, paris/the rex, paris/le pulp. GERMANY:
everywhere! HOLLAND: amsterdam/club paradiso, den haag/transmediale
festival. ITALY: Torino/the loft, Torino/cacao, Bologna/cassero.
JAPAN: tokyo/the womb, tokyo/magnet club. PORTUGAL: coimbra/via
latina, lisbon/op-art. RUSSIA: moscow/mix club. SPAIN: barcelona/the
loft club, barcelona/city hall, valencia/bencassim festival,
madrid/rumble, granada/moshi club. SWITZERLAND: zurich/dackcantine.
TURKEY: istanbul/rock n coke festival. USA: detroit/the shelter, new
york/centro-fly.

Subject: Re: [sfraves] Plaintiffs drop rave lawsuit

Poor Brandon, he's a good kid :(  I bought plenty of tickets and records
from Uprok once upon a time when I lived in Utah.  Unlike popular belief,
the rave scene in the mid - late 90's was awesome.  Almost no hassling
from cops, everything was in the desert or forest spring through fall, if
a party was shut down there was always alternate venue's lined up. 
They've really cracked down ther since that damn 20/20 episode aired.

>>> > HEIDI TOTH - Daily Herald

>>> > The class action lawsuit against Utah County over last year's rave is
>>> > dead, for now.
>>> >
>>> > On Monday, attorney Brian Barnard filed a first amended complaint in
>>> U.S
>>> .
>>> > District Court, opting to "dismiss without prejudice their action and
>>> > claims" against Utah County and several of the county's ranking
>>> officials,
>>> > including all three commissioners, Sheriff James Tracy and County
>>> Attorney
>>> > Kay Bryson. It's a strategic move to give them some time to plan,
>>> > according to one of the plaintiffs.
>>> >
>>> > For the county, though, it's a victory.
>>> >
>>> > The legal hassles aren't over yet, said Peter Stirba, attorney for
>>> the
>>> > county. A judge still has to order the case dismissed, and the county
>>> will
>>> > ask for compensation for its legal fees, which have been significant,
>>> > especially in light of a lawsuit he termed frivolous.
>>> >
>>> > Brandon Fullmer agreed the case wasn't over; he said all of the
>>> involved
>>> > parties decided they needed to regroup and reorganize their campaign.
>>> It
>>> > is by no means over, he said; they will be refiling once the facts
>>> are
>>> > straightened out.
>>> >
>>> > "It's just kind of dragging out," he said.
>>> >
>>> > The lawsuit was filed in September, a few weeks after the Aug. 20
>>> raid
>>> of
>>> > a CD release party on private property in Spanish Fork Canyon.
>>> Promoters
>>> > Fullmer and Nick Mari and landowners Richard and Trudy Childs alleged
>>> > various violations of the constitutional rights of partygoers by the
>>> > sheriff's office, saying excessive force was used to break up the
>>> party
>>> > and that the party was broken up even though UPROCK Records,
>>> Fullmer's
>>> > business, had the correct permits.
>>> >
>>> > The lawsuit also asked for a temporary restraining order that would
>>> not
>>> > allow any more such activities to be broken up until the lawsuit was
>>> > decided; U.S. District Judge Dale Kimball denied that request in
>>> > September, citing multiple violations that gave Tracy the right to
>>> shut
>>> > the party down, including drug use and failure to follow through with
>>> > promised equipment and facilities.
>>> >
>>> > In December, Barnard opened up the possibility of a class action
>>> lawsuit
>>> > and set up a Web site encouraging all partygoers at the Aug. 20 party
>>> or
>>> > an earlier party at the same location that also was broken up to come
>>> > forward and participate.
>>> >
>>> > That Web site has Tuesday's date on it and reads, "This site has been
>>> > taken down as there is no active lawsuit to report on."
>>> >

> does the path is good.  If it doesn't, it is of no use."

Subject: [sfraves] Barry Manilow likes electronica (from  yesterday's Larry King on
 CNN)

[talking about current artists he appreciates]

Manilow: ... since the art of songwriting seems to have taken a nosedive,
I've gone the way of what they call "electronica music" ... I know it's
kind of odd... it's very bizarre music... but it's kinda... they're
breaking the rules ... and/uh ... they're inventive....  and as a musician
I like that.

King: Electronica??

Manilow: It's called electronica.

King: Is it gimmicky?

Manilow: It's not gimmicky. It's interesting music. Interesting grooves.
Interesting ways of playing music... there's no lyrics... there's hardly
any lyrics.

-- Niels
    http://nielsmayer.com

"Look at every path closely and deliberately.  Try it as many times as you think necessary.  Then ask yourself and yourself alone one question.  This question is one that only a very old man asks.  My benefactor told me about it once when I was young and my blood was too vigorous for me to understand it.  Now I do understand it.  I will tell you what it is:  'Does this path have a heart?' If it does the path is good.  If it doesn't, it is of no use."
-Don Juan

"A nation of sheep will beget a government of wolves."
-Edward R. Murrow

"Music is prophecy, its style and economic organization are ahead of the rest of society. It makes audible the new world that will gradually become visible."
-Jacques Attali in his seminal text "Noise"

Subject: [sfraves] BSP:  The Summit

--=====================_3192734==.ALT
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="iso-8859-1"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 8bit


Friday, April 21st 
Massive Selector, Club 6,
& The Poleng Lounge present
The Summit

Once upon a time, in a galaxy far, far away…

there was a monthly party which crisscrossed all musical genres, showcasing a wide array of talent like Jazzy Jeff, Spinna, Hyper, & Jazzanova (to name a few). From hip hop to house, broken beat to nu-jazz, dancehall to lovers rock, turntablism to live music, this genre-less party celebrated musical diversity for more than three years.

After a 2 year hiatus, Massive Selector and friends return to the newly renovated Club Six reviving this legendary party. On April 21, The Summit resumes its quest to bridge the musical gap with a worldwide eclectic lineup featuring…

The King Britt Experience
(with a 4 piece band)
DJ Muro of Japan
45 King (45King.com)
Haul and Mason (Quality SF/LA)

Alongside with
PantyROBber (Massive Selector)
Proof (Massive Selector)
Malex (Massive Selector)
KingMost & DJ Kero One (Plug Label)
Big Taka (FTC/Reflections)

About King Britt
Rarely will you find a talent whose vision supersedes the boundaries of genre, until you have met King Britt. This Philadelphia native has found a way to escape the boundaries of a single category of music by expressing his creations through deep house, hip-hop, broken beat, nu-jazz, funk and afro-tech.

As a member of Digable Planets and as an artist on San Francisco’s own OM Records label, and having worked with artists such as Questlove from the Roots, Ursula Rucker, Macy Gray, Femi Kuti, and others, King Britt's new style fuses influences from various music genres and comes full circle with a LIVE interpretation of all that he has experienced..

About DJ Muro
A former disciple of DJ Krush. Muro the “King of Diggin” is considered one of Japan’s hip hop royalty. As a Pioneer of Japanese hip hop culture, Muro has produced countless tracks and remixes for such labels as Blue Note, Tommy Boy and Def Jam and has worked with several artist including Lord Finesse and A.G.

About 45 King. (from One Stop Hip Hip)
If you don’t know 45 King, then you don’t know Queen Latifah, DJ Kool, Jay Z, or Eminem. This super-producer has been creating hits since the late 80’s. Most DJs world wide have at least one copy of the classic break beat “900 Number” which was first produced in 1987 and later revisited in DJ Kool’s hit “Let me Clear my Throat”.
45 King blew up in an even bigger way in 1998. Hooking up with Jay-Z, the 45 King produced what was to be the biggest rap song of the summer: "It's a Hard Knock Life (Ghetto Anthem)." In 2000, he produced the platinum track "Stan" for Eminem, solidifying his reputation as a top-notch beatmaker. Learn more at 45king.com

About Haul & Mason
Los Angeles based DJ/Producers Haul and Mason are firmly establishing themselves as the party-rocking DJ duo to watch in the coming years. Known for their infamous "2x4 sets," the two So-Cal residents have producing original tracks, playing live with bands, and blowing up dance floors all around the world. Haul & Mason will also re-launch Quality SF @ the Poleng Lounge every 1st Friday of the Month.

$10 before 10pm
$15 before 11pm
$20 after
limited $15 presale at
<http://www.massiveselector.com>massiveselector.com

"Look at every path closely and deliberately.  Try it as many times as you think necessary.  Then ask yourself and yourself alone one question.  This question is one that only a very old man asks.  My benefactor told me about it once when I was young and my blood was too vigorous for me to understand it.  Now I do understand it.  I will tell you what it is:  'Does this path have a heart?' If it does the path is good.  If it doesn't, it is of no use."
-Don Juan

"A nation of sheep will beget a government of wolves."
-Edward R. Murrow

"Music is prophecy, its style and economic organization are ahead of the rest of society. It makes audible the new world that will gradually become visible."
-Jacques Attali in his seminal text "Noise"

We got there around 3:00, some of the first bunnies to arrive. I was a pink, furry bunny, my friend was a blue, sexy bunny. We cracked up at the looks on the faces of the people who didn't realize what was going on, saying 'um, where are all these bunnies coming from?' Pretty surreal if you're just suddenly surrounded by bunnies,  all starting to pack the joint by the time we left at 5:00. We had a great time and I absolutely danced my ass off. 
   
  I really, really loved what was being played downstairs (must've been Aaron Jae?) and I'm only sorry I missed Bam's set, as I heard it was incredible. My only regret is that I didn't bring something else to wear, as dancing in fur pants drains you pretty fast. Big thank you to the crew for such a well-run, friendly and fun way to finish up our night. 
   
  Namaste, MK

Subject: [sfraves] Saturday night review (Where's Waldo)

------=_Part_8081_22790465.1145316206374
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=ISO-8859-1
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable
Content-Disposition: inline

So Saturday night was very cool. It was my first "candy rave" and boy was i=
t
different then normal undergrounds and the club scene. High School kids
everywhere. Very few jaded old-timers. The chill room was going off. Even a=
t
9pm the whole room was melted out. Geeze, these kids start early. I loved
playing my set and it was VERY cool and a personal dream of mine to see my
music make people go nuts. Too bad I had to play straight from my laptop
because someone forgot to bring the CDJ's and my laptop crashed during my
set.

Highlights of the night:
1. A last minute song that I made for the party seemed to get the best
reaction (which suprised me because I had spent so little time on it)
2. Phillip playing his whole set across the room sitting on a bean bag with
his laptop.
3. The old-school style ballons
4. Eesaid's Birthday
5. Osby's fruit
6. Calamity busting out a kick ass set and being a cool person to talk to.
7. The 1 toilet that was overflowed with no toilet paper.

--
Steve Osteen
http://www.tussinspace.com

------=_Part_8081_22790465.1145316206374--

cheese factor aside, barry manilow is quite the musician..  he was a  
guest on the jimmy kimmel show about a year ago, and after watching  
that, i had a new respect for him.  he's intelligent, funny, knows  
his music (i mean, it's his life and livelihood), and can really work  
a crowd.  i'd be interested to hear any electronic releases he comes  
up with.  i bet he'd do something salsa/disco/housey... and that  
you'd LOVE it.

and think about this - in 20 years, your kids will probably think the  
music you made/played/danced to was cheesy...

-pxd-


pat boone is an asshat, by the way.  http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ 
Pat_Boone

Subject: [sfraves] NRR: Rant on Politics and drugs

------=_Part_5070_25086498.1145381677560
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=ISO-8859-1
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable
Content-Disposition: inline

I've used Psudophed this time of year ever since I was a kid. I get really
bad allergy sinus headaches. The only thing that gets rid of the headaches
and pressure is Psudophed and pure ephedrine. Benadryl and other allergy
medicine puts me to sleep and the new psudophed replacement doesn't do shit=
.
So I have to take psudophed. The problem is, I'm treated like a criminal
when I want to go buy it.  I have to show my ID and if the pharmacy is
closed I'm stuck with the headache. Why should I be persecuted because some
people out there use psudophed to make meth? I have no intention to make
meth and have absolutely zero desire to try it. I just want easy access to
psudophed so I can get rid of my headaches.

--
Steve Osteen
http://www.tussinspace.com

------=_Part_5070_25086498.1145381677560--

I saw Barry on American Idol a few weeks back, and though I don't really dig his schtick, I was sort of impressed by him.  He really brought out the best in all the contestants regardless of the style they chose or their relative vocal talents.  Bringing out the best in a wide variety of people is a unique and special talent IMO. Its pretty rare to find someone that can do this.  YMMV. FWIW. etc.

Subject: Re: [sfraves] NRR: Rant on Politics and drugs

Well... I too have run into the pseudophedrine
problem...

BUT...

I just attended a funeral in kansas. Driving down the
highway you see anhydrous ammonia depots all over the
place... which is one of the main ingredients in meth
manufacturing...

So, in addition to being called a left-coaster more
than once... a drunk farmer at "Country Karaoke" told
me that he sells propane tanks of anhydrous to people
when he trucks in the winter for $4000 a tank...

So it isn't us thats causing the problem. We are just
having to suffer the results of the good-ole "Real
American Values" states that make sure we have a
war-monger as president.

Additionally.... becasue of the new us laws against
meth pre-cursers... Mexico is hot on the manufacture.
I recently read an article about how a mexican pharma
company was producing 20% less medication from their
pseudophedrine supply than they were taking in....
meaning the rest was used to produce illicit
substances.

Our government has turned into a bunch of retards that
only make decisions that make the news, and usually on
the heals of a news story itself... What happened to
the idea that you legislate to set up laws that work
for hundreds of years, like the constitution, rather
than pass ridiculous laws that only infringe on the
civil liberties of us regular folks?

E

--0-1740282625-1145395851=:18471
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=iso-8859-1
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 8bit

  Does anybody know if these things work around here?  Chuck
  http://www.cnn.com/2006/US/04/18/traffic.changer.ap/index.html  No green light for driver with traffic signal gadget  'That thing paid for itself'   
  LONGMONT, Colorado (AP) -- A man who said he bought a device that allowed him to change stop lights from red to green received a $50 ticket for suspicion of interfering with a traffic signal.
  Jason Niccum of Longmont, Colorado, said the device, which he bought on eBay for $100, helped him cut his time driving to work.
  "I guess in the two years I had it, that thing paid for itself," he told the Daily Times-Call on Wednesday.
  Niccum was issued a citation March 29 after police said they found him using a strobe-like device to change traffic signals. Police confiscated the device.
  "I'm always running late," police quoted Niccum as saying in an incident report.
  The device, called an Opticon, is similar to what firefighters use to change lights when they respond to emergencies. It emits an infrared pulse that receivers on the traffic lights pick up.
  Niccum was cited after city traffic engineers who noticed repeated traffic light disruptions at certain intersections spotted a white Ford pickup passing by whenever the patterns were disrupted.
  City traffic engineer Joe Olson said engineers plan to update the city's Opticon system this year to block unauthorized light-changing signals.

  Does anybody know if these things work around here?  Chuck
  http://www.cnn.com/2006/US/04/18/traffic.changer.ap/index.html  No green light for driver with traffic signal gadget  'That thing paid for itself'   
  LONGMONT, Colorado (AP) -- A man who said he bought a device that allowed him to change stop lights from red to green received a $50 ticket for suspicion of interfering with a traffic signal.
  Jason Niccum of Longmont, Colorado, said the device, which he bought on eBay for $100, helped him cut his time driving to work.
  "I guess in the two years I had it, that thing paid for itself," he told the Daily Times-Call on Wednesday.
  Niccum was issued a citation March 29 after police said they found him using a strobe-like device to change traffic signals. Police confiscated the device.
  "I'm always running late," police quoted Niccum as saying in an incident report.
  The device, called an Opticon, is similar to what firefighters use to change lights when they respond to emergencies. It emits an infrared pulse that receivers on the traffic lights pick up.
  Niccum was cited after city traffic engineers who noticed repeated traffic light disruptions at certain intersections spotted a white Ford pickup passing by whenever the patterns were disrupted.
  City traffic engineer Joe Olson said engineers plan to update the city's Opticon system this year to block unauthorized light-changing signals.

Subject: [sfraves] Looking for people interested in helping out...

Hey everybody,

We at Stilldream are in the process of gettin ready for our big 6 year 
anniversary campout (June 16, 17 and 18th) and are looking at making it 
better then ever.  Unfortunatly we are having a hard time contacting some of 
our friends who helped out last year and I have decided to put out a request 
for anybody interested in helping out this year.  We are looking for anybody 
who has talents or knowledge with the following subjects.

- Massage Therapist / Aroma Therapy: To set up a massage booth area, where 
people can go in and get a nice massage and rest and relax.

- Glass Blowers: Last year we had Dr. Smile set up a Glass blowing area 
where he spent most of the night blowing beautiful pipes and other objects, 
unfortunatly we just can't get a hold of him.  It was such an awesome part 
of the campout I would hate to not see something of the like out there 
again. :(

- Guided Meditation / Visualization: Something new I'd like to add to the 
campout.  Would love to add maybe 2 times a day a guided meditation 
somewhere around sunset and sunrise. 3 total for the weekend (Saturday 
Morning, Saturday Evening, and Sunday Morning.

Its always hard to find good help so please only respond if you are truely 
interested. If you know somebody who has experience with one or more of the 
talents listed above and would be interested in helping out please forward 
this on to them too.

For more info or questions please email me (Paul) at gamma@techno-truth.com

Thank you for your time.

Paul

www.stilldream.org

Subject: [sfraves] BSP: Robbie Hardkiss, this friday

ROBBIE HARDKISS
With his brothers Scott Hardkiss and Gavin Hardkiss, Robbie Hardkiss
is a central figure in the infamous Hardkiss family of DJs and
musicians. Working in their hometown of San Francisco, the Hardkiss
brothers were instrumental in developing the U.S. rave and outdoor
party scene in the early '90s. Pioneering Hardkiss tunes such as "3
Nudes In A Purple Garden" and "Rainery" helped define the psychedelic
West Coast breakbeat sound that continues to grow today. Their
legendary status within the realm of electronic music was immortalized
with the release of their double album, Delusions of Grandeur.

Since then, Robbie Hardkiss has gone on to remix songs (with and
without his brothers) for artists such as Elton John, Freestylers,
Spacetime Continuum, The Grid, Lords of Acid, The Sandals, Q-Burn, God
Within (aka Scott Hardkiss), and Hawke.

Scott, Gavin and Robbie, the Hardkiss brothers, ruled the underground
San Francisco club scene during the 1990s with a mixture of acid,
trance and breakbeat techno. World-class DJs all, the brothers also
run their own Hardkiss label, releasing material as themselves plus
myriad other artists, including Rabbit in the Moon and Scott's God
Within project. It was Scott and Gavin who formed the group in the
early '90s after experiencing Britain's 1989 Summer of Love firsthand
while studying in Europe. Returning to the States, the two began
promoting and organizing massive raves on the East Coast, but later
moved out to San Francisco to share the vibe with the West as well.
Hooking up with old friend Robbie and christening themselves Hardkiss,
the trio began recording material for their eponymous label. Though
few releases appeared on anything other than vinyl, the label
compilation Delusions of Grandeur serves as a good primer to the
Hardkiss sound. Scott, Robbie and Gavin have each released
compilations detailing their mixing skills as well. ~ John Bush, All
Music Guide


ELEKTRO-PHONIK
1015 Folsom St
Doors at 10pm
$10 all night

with your special guests for the evening:

Robbie Hardkiss - Classic / Sunburn / Boozy + Swan/ www.robbiehardkiss.com

Kidd Linus - boogiebeatrecords.com / Elektro-Phonik.com (SF)
Jason Kincaid - grooves-in-the-park / culture
Bam - Evil Breaks / Invibe (SF)
Marc(O) - Otherworld / The Midnightsons / Ill Behavior/
www.illectrofunk.com (DC/CA)
Edison - Lovelab /GRM / Elektro-Phonik.com (DC)

www.elektro-phonik.com for more info!!!!



--

----- Original Message ----- 
From: "Bam" <invibe@gmail.com>
To: "The Twilight Laser Outpost" <sfraves@hyperreal.org>; 
<breakssf@topica.com>
Sent: Wednesday, April 19, 2006 10:49 AM
Subject: [sfraves] BSP: Robbie Hardkiss, this friday


ROBBIE HARDKISS
With his brothers Scott Hardkiss and Gavin Hardkiss, Robbie Hardkiss
is a central figure in the infamous Hardkiss family of DJs and
musicians. Working in their hometown of San Francisco, the Hardkiss
brothers were instrumental in developing the U.S. rave and outdoor
party scene in the early '90s. Pioneering Hardkiss tunes such as "3
Nudes In A Purple Garden" and "Rainery" helped define the psychedelic
West Coast breakbeat sound that continues to grow today. Their
legendary status within the realm of electronic music was immortalized
with the release of their double album, Delusions of Grandeur.

Since then, Robbie Hardkiss has gone on to remix songs (with and
without his brothers) for artists such as Elton John, Freestylers,
Spacetime Continuum, The Grid, Lords of Acid, The Sandals, Q-Burn, God
Within (aka Scott Hardkiss), and Hawke.

Scott, Gavin and Robbie, the Hardkiss brothers, ruled the underground
San Francisco club scene during the 1990s with a mixture of acid,
trance and breakbeat techno. World-class DJs all, the brothers also
run their own Hardkiss label, releasing material as themselves plus
myriad other artists, including Rabbit in the Moon and Scott's God
Within project. It was Scott and Gavin who formed the group in the
early '90s after experiencing Britain's 1989 Summer of Love firsthand
while studying in Europe. Returning to the States, the two began
promoting and organizing massive raves on the East Coast, but later
moved out to San Francisco to share the vibe with the West as well.
Hooking up with old friend Robbie and christening themselves Hardkiss,
the trio began recording material for their eponymous label. Though
few releases appeared on anything other than vinyl, the label
compilation Delusions of Grandeur serves as a good primer to the
Hardkiss sound. Scott, Robbie and Gavin have each released
compilations detailing their mixing skills as well. ~ John Bush, All
Music Guide


ELEKTRO-PHONIK
1015 Folsom St
Doors at 10pm
$10 all night

with your special guests for the evening:

Robbie Hardkiss - Classic / Sunburn / Boozy + Swan/ www.robbiehardkiss.com

Kidd Linus - boogiebeatrecords.com / Elektro-Phonik.com (SF)
Jason Kincaid - grooves-in-the-park / culture
Bam - Evil Breaks / Invibe (SF)
Marc(O) - Otherworld / The Midnightsons / Ill Behavior/
www.illectrofunk.com (DC/CA)
Edison - Lovelab /GRM / Elektro-Phonik.com (DC)

www.elektro-phonik.com for more info!!!!

> From: "n n s" <nico@viberation.com>

> Subject: Re: [sfraves] BSP: Robbie Hardkiss, this friday

> >I think I saw this guy at some Harmony part at 2nd and Jax.  Was good.

> > n i c o
> > ----- Original Message -----
> > From: "Bam" <invibe@gmail.com>
> > To: "The Twilight Laser Outpost" <sfraves@hyperreal.org>;
> > <breakssf@topica.com>
> > Sent: Wednesday, April 19, 2006 10:49 AM
> > Subject: [sfraves] BSP: Robbie Hardkiss, this friday
> >
> >
> > ROBBIE HARDKISS
> > With his brothers Scott Hardkiss and Gavin Hardkiss, Robbie Hardkiss
> > is a central figure in the infamous Hardkiss family of DJs and
> > musicians. Working in their hometown of San Francisco, the Hardkiss
> > brothers were instrumental in developing the U.S. rave and outdoor
> > party scene in the early '90s. Pioneering Hardkiss tunes such as "3
> > Nudes In A Purple Garden" and "Rainery" helped define the psychedelic
> > West Coast breakbeat sound that continues to grow today. Their
> > legendary status within the realm of electronic music was immortalized
> > with the release of their double album, Delusions of Grandeur.
> >
> > Since then, Robbie Hardkiss has gone on to remix songs (with and
> > without his brothers) for artists such as Elton John, Freestylers,
> > Spacetime Continuum, The Grid, Lords of Acid, The Sandals, Q-Burn, God
> > Within (aka Scott Hardkiss), and Hawke.
> >
> > Scott, Gavin and Robbie, the Hardkiss brothers, ruled the underground
> > San Francisco club scene during the 1990s with a mixture of acid,
> > trance and breakbeat techno. World-class DJs all, the brothers also
> > run their own Hardkiss label, releasing material as themselves plus
> > myriad other artists, including Rabbit in the Moon and Scott's God
> > Within project. It was Scott and Gavin who formed the group in the
> > early '90s after experiencing Britain's 1989 Summer of Love firsthand
> > while studying in Europe. Returning to the States, the two began
> > promoting and organizing massive raves on the East Coast, but later
> > moved out to San Francisco to share the vibe with the West as well.
> > Hooking up with old friend Robbie and christening themselves Hardkiss,
> > the trio began recording material for their eponymous label. Though
> > few releases appeared on anything other than vinyl, the label
> > compilation Delusions of Grandeur serves as a good primer to the
> > Hardkiss sound. Scott, Robbie and Gavin have each released
> > compilations detailing their mixing skills as well. ~ John Bush, All
> > Music Guide
> >
> >
> > ELEKTRO-PHONIK
> > 1015 Folsom St
> > Doors at 10pm
> > $10 all night
> >
> > with your special guests for the evening:
> >
> > Robbie Hardkiss - Classic / Sunburn / Boozy + Swan/
> www.robbiehardkiss.com
> >
> > Kidd Linus - boogiebeatrecords.com / Elektro-Phonik.com (SF)
> > Jason Kincaid - grooves-in-the-park / culture
> > Bam - Evil Breaks / Invibe (SF)
> > Marc(O) - Otherworld / The Midnightsons / Ill Behavior/
> > www.illectrofunk.com (DC/CA)
> > Edison - Lovelab /GRM / Elektro-Phonik.com (DC)
> >
> > www.elektro-phonik.com for more info!!!!

On 4/17/06, Steve Osteen <sosteen@gmail.com> wrote:
> So Saturday night was very cool. It was my first "candy rave" and boy was=
 it
> different then normal undergrounds and the club scene. High School kids
> everywhere. Very few jaded old-timers. The chill room was going off. Even=
 at
> 9pm the whole room was melted out. Geeze, these kids start early. I loved
> playing my set and it was VERY cool and a personal dream of mine to see m=
y
> music make people go nuts. Too bad I had to play straight from my laptop
> because someone forgot to bring the CDJ's and my laptop crashed during my
> set.
>
> Highlights of the night:
> 1. A last minute song that I made for the party seemed to get the best
> reaction (which suprised me because I had spent so little time on it)
> 2. Phillip playing his whole set across the room sitting on a bean bag wi=
th
> his laptop.
> 3. The old-school style ballons
> 4. Eesaid's Birthday
> 5. Osby's fruit
> 6. Calamity busting out a kick ass set and being a cool person to talk to=
.
> 7. The 1 toilet that was overflowed with no toilet paper.
>
> --
> Steve Osteen
> http://www.tussinspace.com
>
>
