From: Rev Billy and The Church of Stop Shopping <Bulletin@revbilly.com>
Subject: Rapture Interruptus Revival! Bay Area 4/26-5/01

www.revbilly.com

The Rapture Interruptus Revival
April 26 - May 1 In Northern California

The fundamentalist plan ­ "The Rapture" ­ is now in progress. People are vanishing, yanked up into another world. These believers are disappearing into SUV's, idling between super malls. They believe, though, with the Playstations in their dashboards, that their Ford Expeditions are climbing straight up cliffs and jumping fjords and running with wolves. That's Heaven's final ad campaign: Consumers on pixilated interstates up Mount Everest. Those of us left behind will die in the Hell and rising Floods of the over-heating planet.

Children, welcome to the The Rapture Interruptus Revival - we shall hit the Rapture right where it hurts. We shall slam the Rapture into Reverse. We shall sing "Stop Shopping" between the consumer and the car ­ catching them in the Parking Lot Of No Return. We plan a new kind of performance art, a curving choreography designed for on-ramps. Exorcisms of Bad Traffic are now being taught in 24 hour all-night shifts at the Slow Consuming School of Divinity…

--WE RELY ON WORD OF MOUTH! PLEASE FORWARD TO FRIENDS AND FAMILY IN THE BAY AREA--

California Schedule - Click Here For Event Information and Reservations!
Wednesday, April 26th 11:30am UFCW Rally ­ Mt. View, Ca
Thursday, April 27th 8:00pm Masonic Center Sebastopol
Friday, April 28th 7:30pm Rio Theater ­ Santa Cruz
Saturday, April 29th 10:00am Westcoast Live Radio, Click To Listen
April 29th, 6:00pm Walnut Park ­ Petaluma
Sunday, April 30th Victoria's Secret Action EMAIL FOR DETAILS
Sunday, April 30th 8:00pm Victoria Theater, San Francisco

On Monday, May 1st we'll be on the streets in San Francisco with the Great American Boycott. Later in May, look for performances in Switzerland, Ohio and New York. Spring-a-lujah!

SPECIAL NOTICE:

THE SFRaves Calendar is being fixed, tested and checked for various 
stresspoints under test.

If you are interested in working on helping to fix the SFRaves 
Calendar or know of someone who is interested in becoming involved 
with the next generation of the SFRaves Calendar Project - please 
email karina@hyperreal.org

If you would like an event posted to the Calendar, please submit to: 
karina@hyperreal.org and it will be listed on the Weekly Calendar 
Mailing.

The SFRaves Calendar is located @
http://www.hyperreal.org/raves/sf/calendar2

Technologies: 
Zope: http://www.zope.org

Experience with / understanding / development experience with *a Plus* :

* authoring and building applications using the Zope application 
framework (http://www.zope.org)
* ZPT 
* Python (http://www.python.org
* PHP
* MYSQL
* Plone

Please note if you are seeing issues with the current calendar (bugs, 
errors, etc) please note that I am aware of them and am currently in 
the process of addressing / fixing these issues.

Please send responses to karina@hyperreal.org

Alternative solutions are also being considered for the next generation 
of this codebase. Other languages are being considered to enhance the 
SFR Calendar Application. This includes languages specific to the 
development of applications in a web environment.

FLAME Ultra Hip-Hop Lounge: DJ Illtrax & Company About 1015: Ten15 
nightclub, a historical landmark in San Francisco, has long been 
considered the national birthplace for world class DJ-centric clubbing. 
A true pioneer in support of electronic music, the club defined itself 
through an uncompromising commitment to quality programming, in 
combination with cutting edge technology. As the longest running club 
in San Francisco, Ten15’s 20-year history is now the material of 
legends. Who's Going? The host of this event has chosen to keep the 
invite list private

Saturday, April 22, 2006 * Earth Day Be-In *

Date & Time:  Saturday, April 22, 2006 - Sunday, April 23, 2006 5:00 PM 
Location:  Somarts 934 Brannan St San Francisco view map More Info: 
415 750 0971 www.somarts.org/ Digital Be-In 14 - Planetwork / the Earth 
Day Be-In For cultural creatives, some of our best community events 
blend conscious entertainment with vital information, visionary ideas, 
useful connections and inspiring art. San Francisco’s Digital Be-In, 
this year in its 14th Edition, is one such event. Since 1989, this 
unique “Gathering of the Cyber Tribes” has shaped the early digital art 
and cyberculture worlds while each year resonating with the human 
vision and passion behind evolutionary technologies, new social 
movements and transformational memes. It has also been a consistent 
showcase of original new music, visual expression and performance arts. 
It’s an annual recalibration of the New Edge. And one good time. Green 
Century Institute, Cyberset Music and Media and a Circle of Co-Creators 
are pleased to announce DIGITAL BE-IN 14: PLANET CODE The Earth Day 
Be-In Saturday April 22, 2006 from 5pm to 4am SomArts Cultural Center 
934 Brannan Street San Francisco complete event information: 
www.be-in.com THREE EVENTS IN ONE! don’t miss: Planet Code Symposium 5 
pm to 9 pm Green Frontier Exhibition 5 pm to 10 pm Eco-Activation 
Celebration – Live Music, DJs and Performances 9 pm to 4 am Tickets 
ONLY $20 in advance, $25 at the door buy online: 
www.inticketing.com/evinfo.php EVENT HIGHLIGHTS The 14th Digital Be-In 
celebrates the further evolution of the digital revolution – building a 
sustainable culture – featuring technology gurus and eco-visionaries, 
and a wide range of compelling solutions for a sustainable culture. The 
evening’s entertainment offers up some the West Coast’s top live music 
acts, vibe-leading DJs, avant-garde performance and mind-opening 
visuals. Organic food and drink, art installations and technology 
exhibits assure an inspired environment for a truly evolutionary Earth 
Day 2006! NETWORKING SALON 5 pm–6 pm – come early to enjoy organic 
refreshments and interact with the speakers, artists, and San 
Francisco’s leaders of digital media and sustainable culture – hosted 
by San Francisco Urban Alliance for Sustainability PLANET CODE 
SYMPOSIUM 6 pm–9 pm – expert panels including Randy Hayes founder Rain 
Forest Action Network; Laurent Pacalin, California Clean Tech Open; 
David Ulansey, Extinction Project; John Clippinger, Harvard Law School 
Berkman Center for Internet & Society; Erik Sundelof, Stanford 
University Digital Visions Program; Jim Fournier, Planetwork, Eprida; 
“Redwood Mary” Kaczorowski, Women’s Global Green Action Network; Greg 
Steltenpohl, Interra Project green community card; Rich Tarnas, author 
“Psych and Cosmos” GREEN FRONTIER EXHIBITION 5 pm–10 pm – dynamic mix 
of forward-thinking groups, sustainable products and services, green 
solutions, and social causes that are leading the way to a green 
economy. CHET HELMS LIVING JAM 10:30–12 midnight – a musical tribute to 
the late Chet Helms – www.chethelms.com – featuring Terry Haggerty, 
Freddy Clarke, Clara Bellino, Jeff Jolly and other Chet family friends 
TBA! NEW EDGE MUSIC 9 pm-on Live: LunaGroove, Foxgluv, Irina 
Mikhailova, Waterjuice, Living Alliance of Love, hands upon black 
earth, Artemis (launching a new digital EP at the event), Divasonic, 
1000% and Random Rab; DJs: Cybervixen, Dov, Goz, KJ, Kode IV, 
Maximillian, Mozaic, Neptune, Shawna, and Laura. Evening speakers 
include Chris Deckker of Earthdance, Patrick Flanagan of Phi-Sciences, 
Erik Davis of Evolver magazine – and more TBA. ART EXHIBITS Evolver 
magazine “Visions on the Green Edge”; Amy Seidman’s ”In Response to 
That" environmental action photo essay; Cory Richardson’s “Katrina 
Relief Moments”; PLUS a landmark SOMARTS exhibit: “The Great Mongol 
State” – Contemporary Art from Mongolia PERFORMANCES Dreamtime Awakened 
directed by Davin S; Sacred Transformational Dance by Estara and others 
TBA Visuals by Dimension7, Stefan G and other SF VJs Sound by ZoneAV 
Décor and sacred installations by Anon Salon and Trinity Domino Special 
Thanks to the many groups and individuals who have co-created to this 
event, including Planetwork, Imaginify, San Francisco Urban Alliance 
for Sustainability, the Evolver Project, Women’s Global Green Action 
Network, California Institute of Integral Studies and Institute of 
Noetic Sciences. The Digital Be-In is a production of Cyberset Music 
and Media www.cyberset.cc in collaboration with the Green Century 
Institute www.greencenturyinstitute.org, Michael Gosney, Founder and 
Executive Producer. SPONSORS CALIFORNIA CLEAN TECH OPEN THE INTERRA 
PROJECT Sun Microsystems Care2.com In-Kind: Adina World Beverages,

Flanagan and Stephanie Sutton for their generous support of Digital 
Be-In 14 and the Green Century Institute www.be-in.com for all the 
latest info, netcast and media archive of event ACTION LINKS please 
follow these links to sustainable culture solutions that are making a

project in Central Arizona Architects/Designers/Planners for Social

Friday, April 28, 2006 * Under Construction *

Date & Time:  Friday, April 28, 2006 more on this date 7:30 PM 
underconstruction 3 april 28, 2006, friday somarts gallery san 
francisco 7:30pm-1:30am fin FREE until 9pm : $10-20 slidiing scale 
9:30pm till close : student & working artist discount :

underconstruction is the original "Iron Designer" project. under 
construction provides a platform for independent San Francisco 
designers and lines to exchange and interact with their peers and in 
new communities. This project preceeds the popular "Project Runway" 
television program, even though they touch on aspects of the same 
experience, the act of making, the process of construction, and the 
magic of performance under pressure. the project inspires indviduals to 
re-think their own relationship to clothing and consumption, and 
encourages people to invest in their own communities and local artists 
by providing a space where the art is accessible and tangible. The 
evening presents lines Anna Conda, Domini, Kyra, Lucid Dawn, Miranda 
Fae, Miranda Caroligne, Tinc and a mystery designer; divided into teams 
of two designers each, each with a live model, a mystery box of fabrics 
and separate production stations. Stylists from Madusalon will design 
styles for each of the models and a makeup team will collaborate live 
on the models. 20 bay area artisan clothing and accessories vendor will 
present objects, outfits and art for purchase with showcase pieces in 
the ambient model installation throughout the space. The evening 
includes performances from Joceyln (Get Freaky), Groundchuck, Boreta 
(Nexus) and Breakbeat Buddha with a closing acapella series from Elke 
Nikol. Flamenco dancer La Malinche will be performing alongside 
projections and live video mixing provided by Satsi (Nexus). Live 
painting from artist Nome Edonna on custom dress designed and 
constructed by miss velvet cream will coincide with the live 
construction. Photographer Sequoia Emmanuelle will provide a live photo 
shoot of the finished construction pieces and models in the gallery 
leading up to the finale fashion show. Sound from El Circo. Fabric 
donated by Discount Fabrics. Full bar hosted by Retox Bar, opening May 
2006. Cash and checks encouraged for vendor purchases, some credit card 
services available. Doors Open at 7:30pm and Live Construction starts 
at 9:30pm. Finale Show at 1am. ~~~~Performance lineup, talent profiles, 
vendors, sponsors, pictures and more: check the website!~~~~ 
www.underconstructionproject.net Under Construction Press 
www.contourmagazine.com/articl...ion.htm LIVE! www.mirandacaroligne.com 
www.eenor.net/lucidweb/fashion/ www.tincwear.com 
www.myspace.com/mirandafae www.madusalon.com ambiance an-ten-nae.net/ 
groundchuck.net www.slidecamp.net www.breakbeatbuddha.com 
www.nomeedonna.com www.missvelvetcream.com www.sequoiaemmanuelle.com 
www.LaMalincheFlamenco.com www.satsi.com crews 
www.discountfabricssf.com www.after5media.com www.elcirco.org 
www.somarts.org

Friday, May 05, 2006 * Boca ** Big Bud ** *

Date & Time:  Friday, May 5, 2006 more on this date 9:00 PM Location:

map More Info:  415-777-4278 www.sfboca.com On Cinco de Drinco, stop by

street from Mezzanine for some deep and dubbed out drum n bass beats. 
Big Bud was one of the most prolific producers on LTJ Bukem's storied 
Good Looking Records label, and has since moved onward and upward. 
Currently, he is running two labels, Sound:Trax and Super8Sound, and is 
on a worldwide tour promoting the remix album of his full-length LP, 
"Fear of Flying"... Those who have witnessed his DJ talents stood in 
awe and brucked out to his seamless mixing and top notch tune 
selection. It's the return of Mr. Nice :-) www.sound-trax.co.uk

Saturday. May 06, 2006 * NAUGHTY's third event - Threesomania! *

Date & Time:  Saturday, May 6, 2006 more on this date 10:00 PM 
Location:  Bohemia SoMa More Info:  415.626.4561 
www.sinfusion.com/naughty Ladies, Gentlemen, and Pervs of all stripes, 
As they say, "the third time's a charm" and we're certain that our 
third event will be as charmed and charming as our lovely clientele. 
And since it's our third Naughty we're gonna celebrate that most 
magnificent triplet - the threesome. People who purchase at least two 
tickets in advance will be able to bring a hot, sexy, newbie guest for 
free!* The weather has turned much more hospitable and the temperature 
is sure to rise just based on your own naughty participation on 
Saturday, May 6, at our favorite undisclosed location. Random will be 
rewarding the first threesome he sees with a special prize so be 
prepared to get busy! For this, our third event, we will also be 
cracking down a bit. We've been lenient for the first two events both 
on dress and affiliation, but no longer. First off, you MUST NOT arrive 
in casual clothes unless you've brought a change of clothes with you to 
the event. No sneakers; no blue jeans; no t-shirts. Secondly, if you 
are a single male we've upped the ante a bit. You preferably need to be 
accompanied to the venue by a member of the fairer sex. Otherwise you 
need to obtain advance permission from the promoters in order to attend 
solo. We, the management, recognize that there are single guys out 
there who are not only long-term loyal customers but also extremely 
well-behaved and a positive addition to any of our events. We look 
forward to adding you to our list of sinFUSION pre-approved gentleman 
and look forward to hearing from you via email to the reply-to address 
from this announcement. But don't dawdle! All such requests must be 
received, at the latest, 36 hours before Threesomania commences. Please 
provide us with the email address you would use when purchasing tickets 
and, if there's any doubt that we'd not know who you are, a picture or 
link to a picture identifying you. All the hassle can of course be 
avoided by recruiting that lovely femme fatale to walk in on your arm. 
It may make for more guaranteed fun as well... Tickets are now on sale 
online at www.sinfusion.com/naughty/p...ckets.php. Buy two or more and 
that sexy extra guest on us! Your DJ's for the Evening: Shatter 
(Bondage a Go Go, Die Maschinen) & Johanna Constantine (Torture Garden, 
Rubber Ball UK) ============================================= Naughty 
Admission restrictions: Single guys must be chaperoned by at least one 
female or obtain prior approval from the promoters. Special: Purchasers 
of two or more tickets can bring a new Naughty guest for free! Dress 
code: Anything but casual (unless you've brought a change of clothing) 
Location: Disclosed to ticket purchasers (and 24 hours before the event

Wednesday, August 02, 2006 * BOOM FESTIVAL Magic *

Date & Time:  Wednesday, August 2, 2006 - Wednesday, August 9, 2006 4:00 AM
Heya, All! We would like to share with you information about a very special
global arts, music and culture-gathering that incarnates biannually in
Portugal. Boom Festival takes place in a stunning outdoor location on the
shore of the Lake Idanha-a-Nova, approximately 2 hours North-West from
Lisboa. Bringing together the latest in psychedelic sights & sounds,
phantastic art installations & workshops, this week-long event is a harmonic
convergence of people, energy, information, and philosophies, from planet
Earth & beyond. Synchronized multi-dimensionally with the full moon of
August, the next Boom-Festival is taking a bio-dynamic approach by
incorporating a variety of sustainable techniques, and Earth-based forms
throughout its infrastructure. Reflecting a harmonic balance of the organic
and the cyber-technologic, Boom 2006 maps the metaphysical framework in
accordance with Peace, Love, Unity and Respect. A very magical event indeed!
5000 BOOM Festival 2006 Early Bird Tickets are available now. They are only
70 Euro for 7 days. Getting there is no big deal. Reasonable flights to
Lisboa can be purchased on most of the European Budget Airlines, and
Transatlantic flights from America are also quite cheap. The Boom has
organized busses that take you directly from the international airport to
the sacred womb of the vacation party paradise. This year, Boom-festival has
extended its length to ONE WEEK! Great news about the timing of BOOM 2006 is
that it's not happening in conjunction with Burning Man, so the devoted
"Burners" have a chance to partake on European creative community
expression. BOOM is similar to Burning Man, but with a lake & great sounds!
Not to be missed ... For more info, please visit: www.boomfestival.org

------------------------------------------------- 
Administrative Notes
-------------------------------------------------

THE SFRaves.org Calendar is sent via email every week. To subscribe to the
list, send a message to: sfraves-calendar-subscribe@hyperreal.org

To remove your address from the list, send a message to:
sfraves-calendar-unsubscribe@hyperreal.org

Send mail to the following for info and FAQ for this list:
sfraves-calendar-info@hyperreal.org or sfraves-calendar-faq@hyperreal.org

If you have events to add to the SFRaves calendar, please publish them by
Friday @ Noon to be included in the SFR Calendar Weekly Edition Mailing.

SFRaves is a not for profit entity serving the Bay Area & all forms of
electronic music for 14 years.

Subject: [sfraves] Neu-Rave: the new wave of guitars and glowsticks 

--=====================_31556343==.ALT
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="iso-8859-1"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 8bit


Neu-Rave: the new wave of guitars and glowsticks 

Monday, 24 April, 2006 
 
As the psychedelic waves of crazy crazes come and go in popular culture or the darker more underground sub cultures, certain ideas plant themselves and evolve with increasing deadly speed. One of these at the moment seems to be the new style of indie music, as its ever looming presence engulfs all in its path, including a hefty slice of old school dance music. 

At the forefront of this quite seemingly random mixture of old and new, guitars and glow sticks, prances The Klaxons who describe themselves as screamo happy hardcore pop. Now if that isn’t the most contradicting genre I’ve ever heard then call me emo. Although this glamorous combination might scare the more emotionally in tune of us away, I do think there is a glimmer of hope here for the unifying opportunities of cross dressing genres. The Klaxons perform as an early 90’s rave tribute, recreating old school acid house rave acts such as Altern-8 and Baby D and more modern techno labels like Cluster Records. Listening to ‘Gravity’s Rainbow’ they sound like all the other indie bands to me, but with more euphoric lyrics – not that that is a bad thing. But then what was I expecting, today you have to sound like NMEs lapdogs to get anywhere. ‘Atlantis to Interzone’ uses some more trance and acid house style sounds, and I think it works well with the punky vocals over the panic sirens.

Scotland’s S***disco are another act hoping to catch the wave before it crashes, and I think they sound nearer to what Neu-Rave suggests. You can hear the influence of Prodigy in their snappy drumming and grimy breakdowns, and this works with the stoner rock-esque voice of the singer of Joe Reeves in ‘Disco Blood’. But they still sound more old school New York punk than British rave.

New Young Pony Club are another outfit ready and willing to provide you with filthy electro grunge food stuffs, but who are they playing for?

As a typical dance music lover I find it hard to see why other ravers would listen to these bands just because they mention old acid house tunes and lyrics and are influenced by early rave. If it’s to really take off a huge fanbase is needed. Luckily these guys have already discovered MySpace and are using it to their full advantage in getting enough contacts to start touring with the right bands and advertising to the open minded new generations of hedonistic guitar lovers.

As I’ve heard more frequently over the past couple of years, techno and electronica is the rock and roll music of the 2000’s, with more passion and enthusiasm than all the long haired ‘alternative’ styles put together.

So is it time for the moaning eighties come backs to retire and the early nineties electronic revival to really bloom?

Only circular time and the short term memory of youth will tell.

Clare Saxon

http://www.wessexscene.co.uk/article.php?sid=1539


MySpace:  http://www.myspace.com/DJApollo 

Tribenet:   <http://people.tribe.net/djapollo2k>http://people.tribe.net/djapollo2k 

Moksha Tribe:  www.mokshatribe.org
                
House Music 101:  http://livingart.com/raving/articles/housemusic101.htm

"Look at every path closely and deliberately.  Try it as many times as you think necessary.  Then ask yourself and yourself alone one question.  This question is one that only a very old man asks.  My benefactor told me about it once when I was young and my blood was too vigorous for me to understand it.  Now I do understand it.  I will tell you what it is:  'Does this path have a heart?' If it does the path is good.  If it doesn't, it is of no use."
-Don Juan

"A nation of sheep will beget a government of wolves."
-Edward R. Murrow

"Music is prophecy, its style and economic organization are ahead of the rest of society. It makes audible the new world that will gradually become visible."
-Jacques Attali in his seminal text "Noise"



--=====================_31556343==.ALT--

Subject: Re: [sfraves] TV-Turnoff Week

I've got you all beat- I'm working on my TV-Turnoff DECADE.  I haven't lived in a house with a TV in it since '98.  Recent developments like YouTube mean I do see a little more content than I used to, but I get to choose it.  I watch the occasional DVD on the computer, so I'm not anti-video.
 
 I just realized at some point that all of the times where I didn't turn the TV on, I could be working on music.  So I just ejected it from my life.  I feel sometimes that I'm missing out on this or that bit of pop culture, but anything really interesting will filter down to me through friends anyway, so... 
 
 It's just never made sense to me to pay for a box and then pay for a monthly subscription so some good stuff will show up on that box, and spend the lion's share of your time being fed advertising BS.  It's like paying somebody to erect a billboard in your living room and shout at you.
 
 ..but that's just my take..
 -gc

You couldn't have expressed the rationale for "TV-Turnoff DECADE"  
better! When I retired in 1995 after 35 years teaching high school, I  
dropped my TV cable service, daily newspaper and magazine  
subscriptions, and switched to the Internet. Healthiest thing I ever  
did in that respect--but I'm not OCD or ADHD either....

Fascism should more properly be called corporatism because it is the  
merger
of state and corporate power.  -- Mussolini

1. Creativity and innovation always builds on the past.
2. The past always tries to control the creativity that builds on it.
3. Free societies enable the future by living in the past.
4. Ours is a less and less a free society.

There are certain spots in GG park that all you need to do is reserve the
picnic area, as long as the party isn't too huge and out of control, you
shouldn't have any problems with the park rangers.  Here's a link to
available picnic areas in GG park:

http://sfgov.org/site/uploadedfiles/recpark/Permits_and_Reservations/GGP_pi=
cnicarea.pdf

Subject: Re: [sfraves] sfr day party?

i can confirm that.  we had a park ranger shut us down last summer,
but basically all he said was if we had paid some $30-50 permit,
everything would have been okay.

correct me if i'm wrong, but we're expecting this thing to be less
than 75-100 people at any given time during the day, right?

if we're expecting more than 100 people at any given time, then i
think we need to look into other permits.  less than 100...no problem.

I dunno Marco, all the EBRP rangers I've run into are hardasses (i've been
ticketed a few times by them and so have my friends).  Back when the park
was run by the port authority you could do all kinds of stuff there, but
since then it's transferred complete authority to EBRP.  I love that spot
though, maybe we should try a test run and see how it goes  :)))

Last year's was insane, I can only imagine what this one will be like.


Rain Dance Camp Out
June 2nd,3rd and 4th 2006

Check www.raindancepresents.com for up to date information on membership
fees / directions / line up/ camping / ect=85

Your presence is requested at the second annual Rain Dance Camp Out.
If you made it last year, then you already know the amount of love and
energy put into this magical experience. Let me tell you
this year will be even more over-the-top, high vibration, frreeky, funky,
jumping, swinging, dancing, swimming, loving, playing,
rompin, stompin, good time.

This Amazing 300 acre camp ground is located 1 hour from
Santa Cruz and 1.5 from San Francisco
features running water, fire rings, bbq's at each camp
full size swimming pool, small lake with canoes, hiking trails, ect

Things to bring - your highest self, camping gear, what ever you need to be
happy
in the woods, your friends and family, flash light, water, sun screen,
bathing suit
scooby snacks, layers ie. changing temperature, love & good vibes

Things not to bring - alcohol, dogs, bad vibes
like Burning Man this is a leave no trace event


This is a members only camp out
this has been sent to you because some one you know wants you to be there

Your membership fees include entrance to the festival, camping, swimming, &
fun
Membership prices are as follows - $40 early bird available until May 1st @
www.inticketing.com/evinfo.php

so get em while there hot
Regular pre registration price of $50 available until June 1st
Streetlight Records 939 Pacific Ave. - Santa Cruz CA
Distractions on Haight - SF

All membership passes at the gate will be $60 no exceptions

If you plan on bringing an RV, Bus, or any other large vehicle you must mak=
e
a reservation through our web site.

The visionary forums will be returning this year with much vital
information....
for updates on this please check the website - www.raindancepresents.com

The Pool party will be in full effect Sat and Sunday!!!

Visionary Art dome will be added this year with many amazing artists
displaying their work, as well as other interactive art surprises.

There will be a day time drumming parade on Sat afternoon

Two sound systems throbbing the night away

Opening ceremony Friday at Sunset

and Relish the Trough

Mime-Version: 1.0 (Apple Message framework v749.3)

From: Apollo <apollo@speakeasy.org>

X-Mailer: Apple Mail (2.749.3)
X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: [sfraves] BSP:  JENO:  THE DEMISE OF "JACK"

--Apple-Mail-1-194724649
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit
Content-Type: text/plain;
	charset=US-ASCII;
	delsp=yes;
	format=flowed

Join me this week in finally celebrating the demise of Jack.

What do I mean by that? Well for starters, I'm finally springcleaning  
my record collection - most of which was locked away in storage for  
several years. It's been an interesting experience, shedding some new  
light on the value and quality of alot of the so called "house" music  
I picked up from the mid/late nineties through into this century.  
Quite frankly alot of it is not much more but a pale imitation of the  
music that preceded it. Not such a big suprise, but clearing it out  
(and in so doing making room for what is going on now, and what is  
yet to come) has been a liberating experience. One I wish to  
celebrate with you on the show this week. So, the first hour or two I  
will therefore devote to old and new music I feel still contains some  
of the spirit of our dear departed ol' friend Jack, after which I'll  
slowly break away from the beats into a more diverse selections of  
music and song..


So Jack is dead, but as surely as we declare his demise, and push his  
lifeless body back into his box, he inevitably returns, popping right  
back out at us when we least expect it, full of surprise. Jack is  
dead - long live Jack..!

For more information about the theme of tonight' show go here -  
http://www.noisefromthevoid.com/board/viewtopic.php? 
topic_view=threads&p=1228&t=300

otherwise go to http://www.90hz.org to LISTEN and CHAT.

9pm - very late..


--Apple-Mail-1-194724649--

apollo@speakeasy.org

MySpace:  http://www.myspace.com/DJApollo

Tribenet:   http://people.tribe.net/djapollo2k

Moksha Tribe:  www.mokshatribe.org

House Music 101:  http://livingart.com/raving/articles/housemusic101.htm



"No sage or savior has ever endorsed greed and gluttony as a path  
toward social justice or personal fulfillment.  These sane and  
enlightened people come to us from all cultures and all eras,  
sometimes knowing of each other but more often not.  Socrates and  
Jesus, Lao Tzu and Tolstoi, Gandhi and Martin Buber -- no one can  
find in their lives and words a jot of support for a political and  
economic regime that encourages the acquisition of wealth far beyond  
what is needed for the necessaries -- or even the restorative  
pleasures -- of life while consigning the masses to live and work in  
squalor."
-Stephen J. Fortunato, Associate Justice, Rhode Island Supreme Court.

"Music is prophecy, its style and economic organization are ahead of  
the rest of society. It makes audible the new world that will  
gradually become visible."
-Jacques Attali in his seminal text "Noise"

GETS IT.

I WILL HOWEVER PWN YOUR RAGTAG TEAM OF TECHNO SOCKPUPPET FUCKETEERS.  BUT 
NOT IN SOME BEATMATCHED COLLABORATION.  I'M TALKING WAR HERE.  
ALTERNATING 10 MINUTE ROUNDS, SHIT TALKING, THE WORKS.

NITROUS OXIDE TURNTABLISM

EACH CONTENDER PLAYS THEIR GEAR WHILE THE OTHER HAS A MIC AND TALKS SHIT 
ABOUT HOW BAD IT SUCKS OVER IT.

MUD WRESTLING

CROWD DECIDES WHO WINS BY VOLUME OF APPLAUSE.

LOSER EATS NUTELLA OFF WINNERS ASS.  REAL SLOW LIKE.  HOPE YOU'RE NOT

Um.. not to make this whole party-planning process any more confusing, but  I 
sort of just had an east bay spot plop in my lap.
 
I know we were trying to get a night party going on last summer, but the  
whole... um... *thing* happened, and a lot of people were too busy to commit, to  
boot.
 
I would hate to see this space be passed up. Are you guys down to have a  day 
party *and* night party this summer? We could spread them out. I can't do  
anything in the beginning of summer anyhow, so I was thinking more toward the  
end for this night party.
 
If you wanna take a ride on the cool "I'm planning an SFR night party"  boat, 
then go ahead and sign up to the planning list by sending an e-mail to 
_sfraves-planners-subscribe@hyperreal.org_ 
(mailto:sfraves-planners-subscribe@hyperreal.org)  with  the words "subscribe" in the body.
 
Heart,
Alida

-------------------------------1146020941--

DO NOT VERSUS ME GC.

I WILL SPLATTER THE WALL BEHIND YOU WITH A PEARLY BUKKAKE SHEEN, LEAVING 
ONLY YOUR SILHOUTTE UNSOILED.

ALSO:

I WILL NOT PLAY LIVE DURING THE DAY.  THE LESS I PLAY OUT, THE MEANER AND 
FUNKIER I GET.  THIS WOULD CAUSE "PROBLEMS" AT A DAY PARTY.

TECHNO IS NIGHT MUSIC FUCKERS UNLESS YOU ARE IN DETROIT AND EVERYBODY 
GETS IT.

I WILL HOWEVER PWN YOUR RAGTAG TEAM OF TECHNO SOCKPUPPET FUCKETEERS.  BUT 
NOT IN SOME BEATMATCHED COLLABORATION.  I'M TALKING WAR HERE.  
ALTERNATING 10 MINUTE ROUNDS, SHIT TALKING, THE WORKS.

ROUND ONE:
NITROUS OXIDE TURNTABLISM

ROUND TWO:
BEER BONG BEATBOXING

ROUND THREE:
EACH CONTENDER PLAYS THEIR GEAR WHILE THE OTHER HAS A MIC AND TALKS SHIT 
ABOUT HOW BAD IT SUCKS OVER IT.

ROUND FOUR:
MUD WRESTLING

CROWD DECIDES WHO WINS BY VOLUME OF APPLAUSE.

LOSER EATS NUTELLA OFF WINNERS ASS.  REAL SLOW LIKE.  HOPE YOU'RE NOT 
ALLERGIC TO HAZELNUT, BITCH.

STANDING ON THE SHIFT KEY CAUSE I'M HOPING FOR CHANGE.

THAT IS ALL
&EUU

andyw - mutorsoundsystem - saturn5.com/andy

> -----Original Message-----
> From: georgeC | origami [mailto:newstylesound@yahoo.com]
> Sent: Monday, April 24, 2006 3:41 PM
> To: J.C.; The Twilight Laser Outpost (West)
> Subject: Re: [sfraves] TV-Turnoff Week
> 
> I've got you all beat- I'm working on my TV-Turnoff DECADE.  I haven't
> lived in a house with a TV in it since '98.  Recent developments like
> YouTube mean I do see a little more content than I used to, but I get to
> choose it.  I watch the occasional DVD on the computer, so I'm not anti-
> video.
> 
>  I just realized at some point that all of the times where I didn't turn
> the TV on, I could be working on music.  So I just ejected it from my
> life.  I feel sometimes that I'm missing out on this or that bit of pop
> culture, but anything really interesting will filter down to me through
> friends anyway, so...
> 
>  It's just never made sense to me to pay for a box and then pay for a
> monthly subscription so some good stuff will show up on that box, and
> spend the lion's share of your time being fed advertising BS.  It's like
> paying somebody to erect a billboard in your living room and shout at you.
> 
>  ..but that's just my take..
>  -gc
> 
>

Subject: [sfraves] BSP: 4/27: Broke-Ass Thursdays with Matt Nee and Mycho Cocoa 

--NextPart_Webmail_9m3u9jl4l_11818_1146075105_0
Content-Type: text/plain
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 8bit

The week is almost over! Come join us, and start your weekend early with resident DJs Evinrude, Dirt, Nugz, m.d.K, Dru, E-Rok, G.A.M.M.A., and special guests. 

This week, 4/27, we're extra-, super-, ultra-proud to feature: 

MATT NEE 
(kompute records / www.komputemusik.com - Chicago) 
Kompute Musik, an independent record label, was established in 1999 by Matt Nee and friends for the purpose of releasing Chicago-style electronic music to the world. Since that time, kompute has released music from some of the world's most innovative recording artists, inspiring a new generation and reaching every corner of the globe. Matt Nee was listed as one of the top 12 DJs in Chicago (along with Traxx, Green Velvet, and Derrick Carter) in Time Out! Chicago October 2005. Check out his techno \ electro, new wave sound. This is by far the biggest artist we've EVER brought to @lpha - not to mention on a weekday! 

MYCHO COCOA 
(The Fringe, SF) 
Well, it's high time we brought this breakbeat ally out to spin some records with us. Mycho is an on-the-rise breaks DJ who has been throwing some killer events and spinning a massive quantity of wicked sets all around the Bay lately. We're excited to finally feature him on our decks. 

We now have drink specials on Thursdays, thus we're putting our beloved "Broke-Ass" name back on this one. Ask the bartenders for the specials, or check the specials board. 

Thursdays are always free, the first beat drops at 9pm, and we go 'til 2am. @lpha bar is located at 3848 Geary, at the corner of 3rd Ave. We'll hope to see you there! 
--NextPart_Webmail_9m3u9jl4l_11818_1146075105_0--

Message-ID: <20060426231038.83041.qmail@web32404.mail.mud.yahoo.com>
Date: Wed, 26 Apr 2006 16:10:38 -0700 (PDT)
From: <dangrsmind@yahoo.com>
Reply-To: dangrsmind@yahoo.com
To: Ben Haus <benhaus@gmail.com>, "J.C." <dougm@kzsu.stanford.edu>
Cc: The Twilight Laser Outpost <sfraves@hyperreal.org>
In-Reply-To: <bdbe1bd30604261450i14600e24j59c1719fbfcf818f@mail.gmail.com>
MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=us-ascii
X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: Re: [sfraves] NRR: 9/11 "conspiracy" film

You should add Umberto Eco's book Focault's Pendulum to your list.  Anyone interested in conspiracy theories should read this book.
 
 In brief:
 
 Be careful what sort of conspiracies you pretend to believe in, because it just might turn out that they are true.  
 
 But if it did turn out that your pet conspiracy theory is true, how would you really know that you weren't just imagining it?  
 
 This way lies madness...
 
 Regards,
 
 Peter
 
 

----- Original Message ----
From: Ben Haus <benhaus@gmail.com>
To: J.C. <dougm@kzsu.stanford.edu>
Cc: The Twilight Laser Outpost <sfraves@hyperreal.org>
Sent: Wednesday, April 26, 2006 2:50:03 PM
Subject: Re: [sfraves] NRR: 9/11 "conspiracy" film

I've seen the video - it only scratches the tip of the iceburg and a lot of
it is more theory than evidence.  If you really want to go indepth about all
the unaswered questions an inconsistencies, PICK UP A BOOK!  Most of the
videos I've seen covering 9/11 are mediocre at best, including the one you
posted.  Try reading the 9/11 works by one of these authors and you'll be a
lot more pissed off, and wonder why so many questions have remained
unanswered:

**Michel Chossudovsky, Paul Thompson, Nafeez Ahmed, Mike Ruppert, Dan
Hopsicker, David Ray Griffin

If you want to dive really deep into it, start out with Mike Ruppert's
crossing the Rubicon, which is the #2 selling book on 9/11 after the Keam
Commission report.  It's a bit long, around 600pp, but covering something
like 9/11 shouldn't cut the corners.

Subject: Re: [sfraves] NRR: 9/11 "conspiracy" film

I arrived in America in my Mom's womb about 1 hour after Kenendy got
capped in Dallas.

Wanna get my attention at a party and have you a cheap laugh in the process=
?

Just say the words 'grassy knoll' or 'Zapruder' or 'second spitter'
and watch my head snap.

It's a curse more than a blessing actually.

Currently I live on Staten Island, 2 minutes by foot from a picture
perfect view of downtown Manhattan, (there were 4 helicopters hovering
outside my kitchen window for most of the day on 9.11), and the home
of the Fresh Kills landfill where most of the Ground Zero debris was
taken.

There are a lot of interesting issues raised by this film, but the
thing I find most lacking, and downright puzzling, in all conspiracy
theories on the subject, be they book or video, (outside of the fact
that no one ever mentions Kurosawa's movie Rashomon when discussing
this), is that how come nobody has come forward to test or give their
test results for traces of the signature for C-4 explosives at Ground
Zero?

Surely, if this indeed was a controlled demolition, as some contend,
it would be impossible to hide the C-4 signature.

This is simple.

No C-4 signature, no controlled demo, no Govt conspiracy.

End of.

For shits and giggles, check out the last 5 minutes of the pilot for
the X-Files spin-off, The Lone Gunmen, which first ran on 4 March
2001, 6 months and one week, exactly, before 9.11 where one of the
towers narrowly misses getting smacked by a remote controlled 747:

http://www.mininova.org/get/183180

Between that, and Tom Clancy, (who no one in this White House reads),
it kinda punches a hole in Condi's assertion that 'no one could have
forseen a plane being used as a missile' now doesn't it?

ha ha.

Face it.

If this truly is a conspiracy, if you value your life and reputation
it's pointless to pursue because if there are people that have the
cajones http://tinyurl.com/n63g2 to pull this sort of thing off, what
makes you think they're going to care what anyone thinks or says on
the subject?

Everyone who ever takes shots at the 9/11 theories always takes shot at the
controlled demolotion.  The fact is, there is a plethora of other evidence
that has led many investigative journalists, families of 9/11 victims, and
informed americans to question why and how these attacks were allowed to
occur.

Other invaluable things to consider outside the controlled demo theory:

NORAD/FAA timeline inconsistencies and revisions
Who is in control of US airspace during a terrorist attack
NORAD wargames taking place on 9/11
Insider Trading
The Phoenix and Minnesota FBI memos
Israeli Mossad (similar to CIA) agents undercover as art students conductin=
g
surveilance of certain 9/11 hijackers
Israeli Mossad agent who was on flight 93
Many of the hijackers turning up alive as reported by BBC among other
credible news sources
Midlevel FBI & CIA agents were stonewalled from upper eschelons of the
government from doing further detective work that could very well have
stopped the 9/11 attacks
Substantial amounts of daming evidence/witnesses were kept outside the kean
commission report... do some research on who was involved on the kean
commission and to whom and what they're connected to, simply be put, it'd b=
e
like putting  a suspected  White Power Murderer on trial, while the judge
and jury is all run by the KKK- would we really be surprised with the
outcome?


Like I said in an earlier email, it'd be impossible to summarize everything
surrounding 911-   if you think I'm full of it, pick up the Kean Commission
Report and compare it to all the inconsistencies David Ray Griffin points
out in his book.   And please, do not point out the controlled demolition
theory as proof the US government is innocent.  It's a shame so many
americans take all this with a grain of salt, there are still so many
unanswered questions, and unless a truly independent commission for looking
911 is formed, I don't think we'll ever find out why these attacks were
allowed to occur.


Other things to check into if you want to see what is to come if Neocons
like Paul Wolfowitz and Corporatist- US nationals like Cheney & Rumsfeld
remain in policy making...  look into the National Energy Policy
(particularly 2000) headed by Dick Cheney along with the PNAC (Plan for a
New American Century) conservative think tank

Could you elaborate on the "C-4 signature?"

Joe Blough <geniusatwerk@gmail.com> wrote:  I arrived in America in my Mom's womb about 1 hour after Kenendy got
capped in Dallas.

Wanna get my attention at a party and have you a cheap laugh in the process?

Just say the words 'grassy knoll' or 'Zapruder' or 'second spitter'
and watch my head snap.

It's a curse more than a blessing actually.

Currently I live on Staten Island, 2 minutes by foot from a picture
perfect view of downtown Manhattan, (there were 4 helicopters hovering
outside my kitchen window for most of the day on 9.11), and the home
of the Fresh Kills landfill where most of the Ground Zero debris was
taken.

There are a lot of interesting issues raised by this film, but the
thing I find most lacking, and downright puzzling, in all conspiracy
theories on the subject, be they book or video, (outside of the fact
that no one ever mentions Kurosawa's movie Rashomon when discussing
this), is that how come nobody has come forward to test or give their
test results for traces of the signature for C-4 explosives at Ground
Zero?

Surely, if this indeed was a controlled demolition, as some contend,
it would be impossible to hide the C-4 signature.

This is simple.

No C-4 signature, no controlled demo, no Govt conspiracy.

End of.

For shits and giggles, check out the last 5 minutes of the pilot for
the X-Files spin-off, The Lone Gunmen, which first ran on 4 March
2001, 6 months and one week, exactly, before 9.11 where one of the
towers narrowly misses getting smacked by a remote controlled 747:

http://www.mininova.org/get/183180

Between that, and Tom Clancy, (who no one in this White House reads),
it kinda punches a hole in Condi's assertion that 'no one could have
forseen a plane being used as a missile' now doesn't it?

ha ha.

Face it.

If this truly is a conspiracy, if you value your life and reputation
it's pointless to pursue because if there are people that have the
cajones http://tinyurl.com/n63g2 to pull this sort of thing off, what
makes you think they're going to care what anyone thinks or says on
the subject?

On 4/27/06, CHUCK G <chuckg_421@yahoo.com> wrote:
> Could you elaborate on the "C-4 signature?"
>
>

Glad to.

TNT, Dynamite, C-4, paraffin, (which has never, ever, werked for me),
nuclear bombs, sugar and chlorine powder, (in a 2;1 ratio, packed
tightly in a metal tube), all leave a unique and distinct chemical
'signature' much akin to a human fingerprint, which makes them easy to
identify.

hope that helps.

Escrow is the point of like the ummm... Hello 2day.. ok.. so like when
someone wants to buy a house.. they put out an offer to the Realitor, then
when that's accepted & the bank payment stuff is starting to proccess..
that's when escrow begins... when all the money stuff in the bank is
sorted and stuff & the house goes to the new owners.. that when escrow
closes.. it's the money thing in buying a house that escrow is mainly like
centered around from what that really nice lady told me :)

um.... almost right.

escrow is where a third, neutral party holds the funds and makes sure =20=

that all the contractual agreements of the sale are met by both parties.

Subject: [sfraves] nrr: Amy Fisher blames Ecstacy

Amy Fisher Blames Ecstasy for Attack
-
Thursday, April 27, 2006

(04-27) 14:20 PDT LOS ANGELES, (AP) --

The Ecstasy made her do it.

Amy Fisher says she was strung out on the club drug when she shot her
boyfriend's wife in the face in 1992.

"I was using Ecstasy, a lot of Ecstasy," Fisher, nicknamed the "Long
Island Lolita," tells "Entertainment Tonight" in an interview that was
to air Thursday. "I had no control."

Fisher was 16 when she visited the home of her much-older lover, Joey
Buttafuoco, a car mechanic on New York's Long Island, and shot his
wife, Mary Jo, as she answered the door.

The drug made her feel "stronger and confident," she says.

"I just did something totally irrational," Fisher says. "Believe me,
rational people don't go to do something like that in the middle of
the day. It's just insane."

She served seven years in prison for the attack.

Buttafuoco pleaded guilty to one count of statutory rape and served
four months in jail. His wife survived the shooting. The couple
remained together after the Fisher affair, but divorced after moving
to California.


URL: http://sfgate.com/cgi-bin/article.cgi?file=3D/news/archive/2006/04/27/=
entertainment/e141737D67.DTL

Subject: [sfraves] [bsp] Special surprise guest TRAXX (int'l deejay gigolos:chicago) FREE tonight @ boca!

Wow! ...YES!!!

On a last minute hook-up we are supremely excited to present a very,
VERY special guest tonight @ our Thursday weekly @ boca!

I have personally seen Traxx on several occasions and have been
thoroughly impressed every time.  The last time I saw him he threw
down a great thumping mix of techno and house with a bit of an electro
/ 80's synth feel to it.  This man is usually Saturday night headliner
material, so to see him for FREE on a Thursday night is truly a
special treat not to be missed.  He will also be joined but another
excellent visiting minimal/tech DJ from Miami, Jason Short (formerly
known as Sattva)!  Tell your friends and get down there tonight.
Traxx will not disappoint!!!


TONIGHT!!!

@ BOCA (the Bar Of Contemporary Art)
414 Jessie St (just around the corner from Mezzanine)
Full bar! + tons of parking @ the 5th and Mission garage
Free / 21+ / 10pm - 2am


:::::::::: T R A X X ::::::::::

( Int'l DeeJay Gigolos . Disko B . Spectral . Antennae . Kompute : Chicago =
)

A musician like no other. Not content to be labeled as merely a DJ, a
producer, or even a DJ/Producer, Traxx is a lover of music. One with a
passion so intense that it overcomes genre divides to weave an
altogether original, exciting, and multi-textured musical fabric which
envelops both the avid clubber and the home listener, as well as
everyone in between. From an early age, Melvin Oliphant surrounded
himself with a wide variety of sounds, from gospel, soul and jazz to
disco, hip hop and nu wave. Growing up in Chicago, however, afforded
him an opportunity many
longed for but never experienced. He lived, first hand, the evolution
of house music into something much more than just an underground
phenomenon, and for this reason, he has a deep understanding of the
history of the sound, and a clear picture of its future. For Traxx,
the future of dance music rests in the hands of those who seek to
expand its boundaries while preserving its past and educating its
devotees. As a self-described "artist of sound," Traxx morphs musical
compositions into distinctive, highly emotional interpretations. He
is, indeed, an innovator, and one who reshapes music into a
progressive, forward-thinking document which defies classification and
invites analysis and discussion. From eclectic and avant-garde tunes
to old school jack tracks and lounge grooves, Traxx hears it all
without discrimination, pretension or elitism.

Here's a recent set to check out!:
Traxx (part 1) at Etikett (Chicago-USA) - 15-02-2006
www.naughtybadfun.org/nbfmixes/Traxx_Etikett_Chicago_021506pt1.MP3


plus another outstanding visiting guest:

::::: JASON SHORT :::::
( Auralism Records : Miami )

Droping the heady and melodic side of minimal and tech-house!


and of course the Thursday regulars:

ALLAND BYALLO  ( liebe*detail . kvadrat produkt . mo's ferry )
SAMMY D  ( classic . dirtybird . utensil )
CRAIG KUNA  ( concept sf . esdjco )

____________________________________

Please spread the word!  See you tonight!


-----> Greg and the [KONTROL] crew

that is the worse defense i have ever heard.

Bam <invibe@gmail.com> wrote: Amy Fisher Blames Ecstasy for Attack
-
Thursday, April 27, 2006

(04-27) 14:20 PDT LOS ANGELES, (AP) --

The Ecstasy made her do it.

Amy Fisher says she was strung out on the club drug when she shot her
boyfriend's wife in the face in 1992.

"I was using Ecstasy, a lot of Ecstasy," Fisher, nicknamed the "Long
Island Lolita," tells "Entertainment Tonight" in an interview that was
to air Thursday. "I had no control."

Fisher was 16 when she visited the home of her much-older lover, Joey
Buttafuoco, a car mechanic on New York's Long Island, and shot his
wife, Mary Jo, as she answered the door.

The drug made her feel "stronger and confident," she says.

"I just did something totally irrational," Fisher says. "Believe me,
rational people don't go to do something like that in the middle of
the day. It's just insane."

She served seven years in prison for the attack.

Buttafuoco pleaded guilty to one count of statutory rape and served
four months in jail. His wife survived the shooting. The couple
remained together after the Fisher affair, but divorced after moving
to California.


URL: http://sfgate.com/cgi-bin/article.cgi?file=/news/archive/2006/04/27/entertainment/e141737D67.DTL

Content-Type: text/plain; charset="us-ascii"


House Ignores Public, Sells Out the Internet

Wednesday, April 26, 2006

SavetheInternet.com Coalition

FOR IMMEDIATE RELEASE: Contact: Trevor Fitzgibbon,
Fenton Communications, 202-246-5303 Craig Aaron, Free
Press, 202-265-1490, x25

House Ignores Public, Sells Out the Internet

Growing Right-Left Coalition Gains Momentum, Looks to
Senate to Save Internet Freedom from Telecom Cartel

WASHINGTON -- Today the House Energy and Commerce
Committee struck a blow to Internet freedom by voting
down a proposal to protect Network Neutrality from
attacks by companies like AT&T, Verizon, and Comcast.

The diverse, bipartisan SavetheInternet.com Coalition
vowed to continue rallying public support for Internet
freedom as the legislation moves to the full House and
Senate. In less than one week, the coalition gathered
more than 250,000 petition signatures, rallied more
than 500 blogs to write about this issue, and flooded
Congress with thousands of phone calls.

The "Markey Amendment" supporting Net Neutrality was
voted down by a vote of 34 to 22. The "Communications
Opportunity, Promotion and Enhancement Act" telecom
law, or COPE Act, passed out of the committee without
any meaningful protection for Net Neutrality. Net
Neutrality means all online activity must be treated
equally, and companies like AT&T must allow Internet
users to view the smallest blog just as easily as the
largest corporate Web site.

"The Commerce Committee is headed in the
opposite direction of where the American public wants
to go," said Columbia Law Professor Timothy Wu, a pro-
market advocate and one of the intellectual architects
of the Net Neutrality principle."Most people favor an
open and neutral Internet and don't want Internet
gatekeepers taxing and tollboothing innovation."

Major telecom companies like AT&T and Verizon are
spending hundreds of millions of dollars to get
Congress to change the rules to let them discriminate
on the Internet -- forcing Web sites to pay "protection
money" to ensure their sites will work properly.

"Predictably, the careerist politicians on the House
Energy and Commerce Committee rolled right over in
their frantic desire to do the telecoms' bidding," said
Craig Fields, director of Internet operations for Gun
Owners of America. "It makes no difference to them
whether the Internet will remain a free and vibrant
marketplace of ideas. As far as they are concerned, if
big business is happy, all is right with America. And
so we look with hope to the Senate, that supposedly
august body, which prides itself on its more
'deliberative' pace and tone. They paint themselves as
conscientious adults -- perhaps, just perhaps, they'll
actually act like such when it is their turn to decide
the future of the Internet."

Groups on the right and left have banded together, and
hundreds of bloggers from across the political spectrum
have galvanized behind this cause, with more than 500
blogs pointing their readers to SavetheInternet.com.

"It's shocking that the House continues to deny
the will of the people on an issue that affects
everyone so directly -- protecting the free and open
Internet," said Eli Pariser, Executive Director of
MoveOn.org Civic Action. "Our bipartisan coalition will
rally the online community like it's never been
rallied before, and together the public will overturn
today's enormous blow to the freedom principle
that's made the Internet great."

"Commerce and free expression on the Internet have
flourished because it's available to everyone on the
same basis," said Glenn Reynolds, of libertarian blog
Instapundit.com. "That's how it should continue to be."

The SavetheInternet.com coalition includes: Gun Owners
of America, MoveOn.org Civic Action, Craig Newmark of
Craigslist, Glenn Reynolds (a.k.a. libertarian blogger
Instapundit), Parents Television Council, United Church
of Christ, the American Library Association, the
Consumer Federation of America, Consumers Union, Common
Cause, Public Knowledge, and other major public
interest groups. The coalition is spearheaded by Free
Press, a national, nonpartisan group focused on media
reform and Internet policy issues. The rapidly
expanding list of groups supporting Internet freedom is
available at www.SavetheInternet.com.

"The diversity of this coalition underscores the
importance of this issue," said Vint Cerf, one of the
fathers of the Internet and Google's Chief Internet
Evangelist. "When the Internet started, you didn't have
to get permission to start companies. You just got on
the Net and started your idea."

The COPE Act next moves from the committee to a full
House vote. The Senate Commerce Committee is expected
to take up Net Neutrality legislation in the coming
weeks.

"The House vote today ignores a groundswell of popular
support for Internet freedom," said Ben Scott, policy
director of Free Press. "We hope that the full House
will resist the big telecom companies and reject the
bill. But we look to the Senate to restore meaningful
protections for net neutrality and ensure that the
Internet remains open to unlimited economic innovation,
civic involvement and free speech."

For more information, visit www.SavetheInternet.com



------------------------------

"Look at every path closely and deliberately.  Try it as many times as you think necessary.  Then ask yourself and yourself alone one question.  This question is one that only a very old man asks.  My benefactor told me about it once when I was young and my blood was too vigorous for me to understand it.  Now I do understand it.  I will tell you what it is:  'Does this path have a heart?' If it does the path is good.  If it doesn't, it is of no use."
-Don Juan

"A nation of sheep will beget a government of wolves."
-Edward R. Murrow

"Music is prophecy, its style and economic organization are ahead of the rest of society. It makes audible the new world that will gradually become visible."
-Jacques Attali in his seminal text "Noise"

From: Apollo <apollo@speakeasy.org>

Subject: [sfraves] BSP:  Special Announcement and Updates from Love Parade SF

--Apple-Mail-1-440954650
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit
Content-Type: text/plain;
	charset=US-ASCII;
	delsp=yes;
	format=flowed

Greetings from the crew that brought you Love Parade San Francisco  
'04 and '05!

This is an update on what's been happening at Love HQ in our efforts  
to bring America's premiere electronic music event back to the  
streets of San Francisco.

We are proud to announce the Love will return Fall, 2006!

Once again we'll be hosting the city's, country's and world's best  
electronic music DJ's and music producers with a full on free parade  
down the heart of San Francisco, festival at the Civic Center plaza,  
take over of City Hall, and more pre-parties, after parties, and  
after-after parties this side of WMC.

This parade and festival will not bear the name 'Love Parade' this  
year, as Love Parade Berlin, who we were licensed through the  
previous 2 years, did not renew -any- of their world wide licenses  
not already under contract so they could focus on their own event  
this July, the first Love Parade Berlin in 2 years. We all remain on  
great terms and wish each other amazing events!

Left with the decision of what to do, the same team that organized  
previous SF LP events felt we couldn't let the momentum, work and  
excitement of our first 2 amazingly successful turn outs take a year  
off to wait and see what happens with Berlin next year. We're excited  
to bring the same concept that makes Love Parade so amazing, and make  
it our own, and take it up a notch with a fresh start building on  
past efforts.

An outdoor all day parade and festival showcasing electronic dance  
music, and the wonderful culture that surrounds it, a culture that  
values a lot of things the world needs right now - unity,  
friendliness, respect, tolerance, spirit, cooperation, and fun.  
You're invited once again to make that shine, so get ready for more  
love!

The original founder of Love Parade Berlin, Dr. Motte told us: "I  
would be happy to work close and direct together with you to keep the  
spirit of loveparade alive beyond all borders."

Sounds like a plan! We'll be hearing more from Dr. Motte....

Now moving ahead.... very special thanks again to all who supported  
our benefits in January and February. Though our basically equivalent  
event is not called 'Love Parade' this year, your support was not and  
will not be in vain. The same organization has the same bills to pay  
to the city, and still has them to pay to secure our permits for this  
year. At the time we threw them we had not heard Berlin was not  
renewing any LP licenses, thus they were at that time 'Love Parade'  
benefits. As you may recall, the increased costs associated with the  
Market St. / Civic Center event, coupled with not enough people  
donating at the festival gates - a key component of how we cover our  
expenses, resulted in us ending the event in the red. We've corrected  
those snags in this year's plan, but are hoping for your support one  
more time before the love returns.

Friday, May 12th, the creators of Love Parade 04 and 05 bring you:
True Love Never Dies: a benefit event for the Love event 2006.

Presented by Spundae, Mezzanine, Flirty Flirty, Satellite SF, Wink,  
and Drive. Mezzanine has donated their amazing club and sound system  
for another eclectic night of world class music featuring.

Markus Schultz (markusschultz.com /Armada Music)
Matthew Dekay (mathewdekay.nl / Holland)
+
Scott Carrelli (Satellite / Qool)
Alain Octavo (Spundae / Wink)
Bali (djbali.com / Flirty Flirty)
8 Ball (Space Cowboys)
Will Spencer (Drive)
Mozaic (Raindance)
Shooey (In Deep / Deep End)
Jonboy(Dubalicious)


Check www.spundae.com for $10 pre-sales.

We encourage nation wide party people interested in doing a float at  
this years event to start getting ready. Lots more updates coming  
soon, including our new web launch, our final name (working out  
trademark issues now), and our final date (should be confirmed next  
week.)

If you have questions feel free to reply to this e mail.

We're excited to co-create more love with you all, thanks for your  
support!

The Love Team '06.


--Apple-Mail-1-440954650--

The EGR 8 year went down quite well out here in SF.  Got some quality 
techno heads together from around the country and had at it. Wished there 
was more stuff going on like this in SF et al, but such is life.. 
Unfortunately a bunch of things changed for me after the 8 year, so I don't 
know when I'm hosting another event... This one was kick ass though... :)

I was going to record another studio mix of more electro-tech type stuff, 
but just didn't have it in me around the 8 year event.. I was rather angry 
and stuff... However, I'm DJing at The End Up in SF 
(http://www.theendup.com/) Thursday May 4th midnight to 2am (fri morn) and 
plan to record the live mix and release that as I kind of need a club to 
play that kind of stuff anyway.. Still edgy, but maybe a little more 
accessible. Hope some of you can make it out; send me an email and I'll see 
if I can work out some sort of guest list; dunno on that one yet. Heh.. 
I'll try to stick in some real dark stuff though too depending on the scene.

Best,
--Mike

Egregious
"Renewal through music for those outside the heard."
http://www.egregious.net/

_________________________________________________________________________
 
 
Limbaugh Arrested on Drug  Charges
 (http://ar.atwola.com/link/93179288/294186514/aoladp?target=_blank&border=0) 
WEST PALM BEACH, Fla. (April 28) - Rush Limbaugh was  arrested Friday on 
prescription drug charges, with his attorney saying he has  reached a deal with 
prosecutors that will eventually see the charges dismissed  if he continues 
treatment for drug addiction. 
Limbaugh turned himself in to authorities on a warrant  issued by the State 
Attorney's Office, said Teri Barbera, a spokeswoman for the  State Attorney's 
Office. 
The conservative radio commentator came into the jail at  about 4 p.m. with 
his attorney Roy Black and left an hour later after posting  $3,000 bail, 
Barbera said. The warrant was for fraud to conceal information to  obtain 
prescriptions, Barbera said. 
Black said his client and prosecutors reached a settlement  on a charge of 
doctor shopping filed Friday by the State Attorney, which Black  said will be 
dismissed in 18 months if Limbaugh complies with court  guidelines. 
As a primary condition of the dismissal, Limbaugh must  continue to seek 
treatment from the doctor he has seen for the past 2 1/2 years,  Black said. 
Limbaugh entered a plea of not guilty in court Friday on  the charge and 
Black maintained his client's innocence. 
"Mr. Limbaugh and I have maintained from the start that  there was no doctor 
shopping, and we continue to hold this position," Black said  in an e-mailed 
statement. 
Prosecutors began investigating Limbaugh in 2003 after a  tabloid newspaper 
reported that his housekeeper said he had used her to  illegally buy 
painkillers. He soon took a five-week leave from his radio show to  enter a 
rehabilitation program. 
Prosecutors seized Limbaugh's records after learning that  he received about 
2,000 painkillers, prescribed by four doctors in six months,  at a pharmacy 
near his Palm Beach mansion. They contended that Limbaugh engaged  in "doctor 
shopping," or illegally deceived multiple doctors to receive  overlapping 
prescriptions. 
Limbaugh acknowledged he became addicted to pain  medication, blaming it on 
severe back pain. 
According to Black, Limbaugh also has agreed to make a  $30,000 payment to 
the state to defray the public cost of the investigation. The  agreement also 
provides that he must refrain from violating the law during this  18 months, 
must pay $30 per month for the cost of supervision and comply with  other similar 
provisions of the agreement. 
04-28-06 18:48 EDT 
Copyright 2006 The Associated Press. The  information contained in the AP 
news report may not be published, broadcast,  rewritten or otherwise distributed 
without the prior written authority of The  Associated Press. All active 
hyperlinks have been inserted by AOL. 


-------------------------------1146267295--

Subject: [sfraves] SFRaves Calendar 042806

The Freshness

When it's cold and raining,
you are more beautiful.

And the snow brings me
even closer to your lips.

The inner secret, that which was never born,
you are that freshness, and I am with you now.

I can't explain the goings,
or the comings. You enter suddenly,

and I am nowhere again.
Inside the majesty.

Translator: Coleman Barks

-- Poem By Rumi

SPECIAL NOTICE:

THE SFRaves Calendar is being fixed, tested and checked for various
stresspoints under test.

If you are interested in working on helping to fix the SFRaves Calendar or
know of someone who is interested in becoming involved with the next
generation of the SFRaves Calendar Project - please email
karina@hyperreal.org

If you would like an event posted to the Calendar, please submit to:
karina@hyperreal.org and it will be listed on the Weekly Calendar Mailing.

The SFRaves Calendar is located @
http://www.hyperreal.org/raves/sf/calendar2

Technologies: Zope: http://www.zope.org

Experience with / understanding / development experience with *a Plus* :

* authoring and building applications using the Zope application framework
(http://www.zope.org)
* ZPT * Python (http://www.python.org
* PHP
* MYSQL
* Plone

Please note if you are seeing issues with the current calendar (bugs,
errors, etc) please note that I am aware of them and am currently in the
process of addressing / fixing these issues.

Please send responses to karina@hyperreal.org

Alternative solutions are also being considered for the next generation of
this codebase. Other languages are being considered to enhance the SFR
Calendar Application. This includes languages specific to the development of
applications in a web environment.

-- 
**************************************************************
******************>karina@hyperreal.org<**********************

much in despairing of life as in hoping for another life
& in eluding the implacable grandeur of this life.
-- Albert Camus -- *******************************************

Friday, April 28, 2006 * Triple Power 2 YEAR ANNIVERSARY w/ OOAH *

Date & Time:  Friday, April 28, 2006 more on this date 9:00 PM Location:
Shine 1337 mission St. San Francisco, CA view map With a lot of bump & grind
and whoop & holla, you all have helped us continue to build what started as
a little shindig into a rockin~R party, with, IMHO, one of the best
underground crowds in SF. Thanks to all of you who keep keepin~R it growing
and building the momentum to take us all higher. On to another year full of
funky beats, far out performers, and a wicked vibe. This month~Rs guest DJs
OOAH :: Troubled Youth/L.A.B.A. :: www.labadj.com/ooah.html Known for his
funky, krunky breaks and mad turntablist magic, he~Rs blowing up the west
coast underground with a supafly style. Seriously, this guy is the sh*t. KEM
:: www.kemsf.com A superpro SF DJ and producer who started America~Rs first
HardNRG record label (Lotek Records), Kem will be whonking the party with
his eclectic mix of deep, funky, techy, and tribal house. And of course,
here to serve up the high calorie, deep-fried phat and phunky beats with
plenty o~R sauce, rezzies SHANTI and GIAMMA Live percussion with SOOZHYQ
Science and magic by GUN the Transformer Images by Synaesthesia 9pm-2am
SHINE @ 1337 mission b/t 9th & 10th soma, sf Drink specials? Flip for it
Friday -- order your drinks, flip a coin, if you call it right your round is
free. $4 until 10pm $7 after 10pm 21+ <<< TRIPLE POWER >>> your super
strength monthly 4th fridays | every month www.triplepower.org Join the
mailing list: groups.yahoo.com/group/triplepower Join the tribe:
www.triplepower.tribe.net

Friday, April 28, 2006 * Under Construction *

Date & Time:  Friday, April 28, 2006 more on this date 7:30 PM
underconstruction 3 april 28, 2006, friday somarts gallery san francisco
7:30pm-1:30am fin FREE until 9pm : $10-20 slidiing scale 9:30pm till close :
student & working artist discount :

underconstruction is the original "Iron Designer" project. under
construction provides a platform for independent San Francisco designers and
lines to exchange and interact with their peers and in new communities. This
project preceeds the popular "Project Runway" television program, even
though they touch on aspects of the same experience, the act of making, the
process of construction, and the magic of performance under pressure. the
project inspires indviduals to re-think their own relationship to clothing
and consumption, and encourages people to invest in their own communities
and local artists by providing a space where the art is accessible and
tangible. The evening presents lines Anna Conda, Domini, Kyra, Lucid Dawn,
Miranda Fae, Miranda Caroligne, Tinc and a mystery designer; divided into
teams of two designers each, each with a live model, a mystery box of
fabrics and separate production stations. Stylists from Madusalon will
design styles for each of the models and a makeup team will collaborate live
on the models. 20 bay area artisan clothing and accessories vendor will
present objects, outfits and art for purchase with showcase pieces in the
ambient model installation throughout the space. The evening includes
performances from Joceyln (Get Freaky), Groundchuck, Boreta (Nexus) and
Breakbeat Buddha with a closing acapella series from Elke Nikol. Flamenco
dancer La Malinche will be performing alongside projections and live video
mixing provided by Satsi (Nexus). Live painting from artist Nome Edonna on
custom dress designed and constructed by miss velvet cream will coincide
with the live construction. Photographer Sequoia Emmanuelle will provide a
live photo shoot of the finished construction pieces and models in the
gallery leading up to the finale fashion show. Sound from El Circo. Fabric
donated by Discount Fabrics. Full bar hosted by Retox Bar, opening May 2006.
Cash and checks encouraged for vendor purchases, some credit card services
available. Doors Open at 7:30pm and Live Construction starts at 9:30pm.
Finale Show at 1am. ~~~~Performance lineup, talent profiles, vendors,
sponsors, pictures and more: check the website!~~~~
www.underconstructionproject.net Under Construction Press
www.contourmagazine.com/articl...ion.htm LIVE! www.mirandacaroligne.com
www.eenor.net/lucidweb/fashion/ www.tincwear.com www.myspace.com/mirandafae
www.madusalon.com ambiance an-ten-nae.net/ groundchuck.net www.slidecamp.net
www.breakbeatbuddha.com www.nomeedonna.com www.missvelvetcream.com
www.sequoiaemmanuelle.com www.LaMalincheFlamenco.com www.satsi.com crews
www.discountfabricssf.com www.after5media.com www.elcirco.org
www.somarts.org

Saturday, April 29, 2006 * Anthem ! By Plays Kool *

Join us at ANTHEM! as we celebrate our favorite dance floor songs! With DJs:
Majere (Plays Kool), The Nice Guys (No Left Turn vs. Reese), Carlos Alfonzo
(Bay Raves), The Doctor (Bay Raves), Sal DJ vs. Brett James vs. Plate
Tektoniks (Cal Trance), Channel Surfer (F-8, Fire Tribe), Doza (Zapatistas),
Nick Nyquil, Aleks (a10), Riff Raff (Zapatistas), Crackerjack (Hard Heads),
Lukasz (Plays Kool), Sideshow (HCFTF), AdamAnt (Love Allstars), Hi-C,
Illumin (Illumin Industries), Miss Haze (Elev8), Andy P (Nocturnalism).
Enjoy a fun filled night of music, dancing, friends, art, and entertainment.
Dress up and shine like a star! Special treatment and prizes for dancers in
costume! 9pm-4am. Info : 415.267.6921

Saturday, April 29. 2006 * Supperclub & Tantra Present: Naked Tourist
(Berlin) with Punkadelik art & fashion! *

Date & Time:  Saturday, April 29, 2006 more on this date 11:00 PM Punkadelik
After Dinner Party Saturday, April 29, 11pm-6am supperclub san francisco 657
harrison @ 3rd LA SALLE NEIGE NAKED TOURIST (Parvati Records, Berlin) hear
samples at tantrasf.com/ Liam Shy (Tantra) KJ (Tantra) Ricardo Cassetari
(Dragonfly Records/INgrooves) LA SALLE PRIVE Irina Mikhailova (Interchill
Records) B. Smiley (Late Night Sneaky) Saturnia (Celestial Dragon Records)
VIRTUAL PUNKADELIK ART SHOW - including custom Punkadelik animation by Dr.
Spook punkadelik.com/, geomagnetic.tv/ supperclub and Tantra welcome you to
an evening of elektrik art, music, fashion and performance, celebrating the
release of Mad Different Methods by German psytrance artist Naked Tourist
and the Punkadelik vision of Antoine Merger of France. supperclub staff as
well as performers will adopt Punkadelik themed attire and we hope you will
too. Arrive in Punkadelik fashion for $15 entry as well as be eligible for
prizes for best Punkadelik attire. For this occasion, Spook will be
preparing special animations of Punkadelik paintings, that will form the
basis of a future animated Punkadelik DVD. Come early for dinner for the
full on supperclub experience with a rare downtempo and psyhouse set by KJ.
Sound reinforcement by Tantra View the flyer at tantrasf.com $20 at door,
21+ $15 in Punkadelik attire. Prizes for most creative Punkadelik attire
Punkadelik Performances TBA For dinner reservations call 415-348-0900 or
visit www.supperclub.com/

Friday, May 05, 2006 * Boca ** Big Bud ** *

Date & Time:  Friday, May 5, 2006 more on this date 9:00 PM Location: BOCA
(Bar of Contemporary Art) 414 Jessie Street San Francisco, CA view map More
Info:  415-777-4278 www.sfboca.com On Cinco de Drinco, stop by BOCA (Bar of
Contemporary Art) here in San Francisco, just down the street from Mezzanine
for some deep and dubbed out drum n bass beats. Big Bud was one of the most
prolific producers on LTJ Bukem's storied Good Looking Records label, and
has since moved onward and upward. Currently, he is running two labels,
Sound:Trax and Super8Sound, and is on a worldwide tour promoting the remix
album of his full-length LP, "Fear of Flying"... Those who have witnessed
his DJ talents stood in awe and brucked out to his seamless mixing and top
notch tune selection. It's the return of Mr. Nice :-) www.sound-trax.co.uk
www.stilldoinit.com www.sfboca.com www.nitewise.com www.blasthaus.com

Saturday. May 06, 2006 * NAUGHTY's third event - Threesomania! *

Date & Time:  Saturday, May 6, 2006 more on this date 10:00 PM Location:
Bohemia SoMa More Info:  415.626.4561 www.sinfusion.com/naughty Ladies,
Gentlemen, and Pervs of all stripes, As they say, "the third time's a charm"
and we're certain that our third event will be as charmed and charming as
our lovely clientele. And since it's our third Naughty we're gonna celebrate
that most magnificent triplet - the threesome. People who purchase at least
two tickets in advance will be able to bring a hot, sexy, newbie guest for
free!* The weather has turned much more hospitable and the temperature is
sure to rise just based on your own naughty participation on Saturday, May
6, at our favorite undisclosed location. Random will be rewarding the first
threesome he sees with a special prize so be prepared to get busy! For this,
our third event, we will also be cracking down a bit. We've been lenient for
the first two events both on dress and affiliation, but no longer. First
off, you MUST NOT arrive in casual clothes unless you've brought a change of
clothes with you to the event. No sneakers; no blue jeans; no t-shirts.
Secondly, if you are a single male we've upped the ante a bit. You
preferably need to be accompanied to the venue by a member of the fairer
sex. Otherwise you need to obtain advance permission from the promoters in
order to attend solo. We, the management, recognize that there are single
guys out there who are not only long-term loyal customers but also extremely
well-behaved and a positive addition to any of our events. We look forward
to adding you to our list of sinFUSION pre-approved gentleman and look
forward to hearing from you via email to the reply-to address from this
announcement. But don't dawdle! All such requests must be received, at the
latest, 36 hours before Threesomania commences. Please provide us with the
email address you would use when purchasing tickets and, if there's any
doubt that we'd not know who you are, a picture or link to a picture
identifying you. All the hassle can of course be avoided by recruiting that
lovely femme fatale to walk in on your arm. It may make for more guaranteed
fun as well... Tickets are now on sale online at
www.sinfusion.com/naughty/p...ckets.php. Buy two or more and that sexy extra
guest on us! Your DJ's for the Evening: Shatter (Bondage a Go Go, Die
Maschinen) & Johanna Constantine (Torture Garden, Rubber Ball UK)
============================================= Naughty Admission
restrictions: Single guys must be chaperoned by at least one female or
obtain prior approval from the promoters. Special: Purchasers of two or more
tickets can bring a new Naughty guest for free! Dress code: Anything but
casual (unless you've brought a change of clothing) Location: Disclosed to
ticket purchasers (and 24 hours before the event

Friday, May 19, 2006 * Sound Asylum I by Dj Denise and MizumoMusic *

This will be a weekend full of Sound Asylum!  Two separate nights with
different music themes.  Friday's theme: Trance, Hard Dance, Techno, Psy.
with DJs: Thee-O (Biohazard/Addicted/Go Ventures/26c, LA), Dyloot
(SkillsDJ/Deep Voices/Adjusted/Noys), Denise (Mizumo Music/DjDenise), Liam
Shy (TantraSF), Aleks (A10Records), T-Bot (HardWired/Nosebleed/Infectious),
DJ Reminisce (All in The Family Prod./Earwacks.com).  9pm-4am, 18+ with ID,
very limited capacity in a secure and permitted SF venue.  More info:
415-267-7656

Saturday, May 20, 2006 * Sound Asylum II by Dj Denise and MizumoMusic *

with different music themes.  Saturday's theme: House, Breaks, Drum n Bass.

(ForestGreen/Sister SF/Daly City Records), Denise (Mizumo Music/DjDenise),
